   20: -module(compile_SUITE).
   21: 
   22: %% Tests compile:file/1 and compile:file/2 with various options.
   23: 
   24: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   25: -include_lib("stdlib/include/erl_compile.hrl").
   26: 
   27: -export([all/0, suite/0,groups/0,init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1, 
   28: 	 init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2,
   29: 	 app_test/1,appup_test/1,bigE_roundtrip/1,
   30: 	 debug_info/4, custom_debug_info/1, custom_compile_info/1,
   31: 	 file_1/1, forms_2/1, module_mismatch/1, outdir/1,
   32: 	 binary/1, makedep/1, cond_and_ifdef/1, listings/1, listings_big/1,
   33: 	 other_output/1, encrypted_abstr/1,
   34: 	 strict_record/1, utf8_atoms/1, utf8_functions/1, extra_chunks/1,
   35: 	 cover/1, env/1, core_pp/1, tuple_calls/1,
   36: 	 core_roundtrip/1, asm/1, asm_labels/1,
   37: 	 sys_pre_attributes/1, dialyzer/1, no_core_prepare/1,
   38: 	 warnings/1, pre_load_check/1, env_compiler_options/1,
   39:          bc_options/1, deterministic_include/1, deterministic_paths/1,
   40:          compile_attribute/1, message_printing/1, other_options/1,
   41:          transforms/1, erl_compile_api/1, types_pp/1, bs_init_writable/1,
   42:          annotations_pp/1, option_order/1
   43: 	]).
   44: 
   45: suite() -> [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]}].
   46: 
   47: %% To cover the stripping of 'type' and 'spec' in beam_asm.
   48: -type all_return_type() :: [atom()].
   49: -spec all() -> all_return_type().
   50: 
   51: all() -> 
   52:     [app_test, appup_test, bigE_roundtrip, file_1,
   53:      forms_2, module_mismatch, outdir,
   54:      binary, makedep, cond_and_ifdef, listings, listings_big,
   55:      other_output, encrypted_abstr, tuple_calls,
   56:      strict_record, utf8_atoms, utf8_functions, extra_chunks,
   57:      cover, env, core_pp, core_roundtrip, asm, asm_labels, no_core_prepare,
   58:      sys_pre_attributes, dialyzer, warnings, pre_load_check,
   59:      env_compiler_options, custom_debug_info, bc_options,
   60:      custom_compile_info, deterministic_include, deterministic_paths,
   61:      compile_attribute, message_printing, other_options, transforms,
   62:      erl_compile_api, types_pp, bs_init_writable, annotations_pp,
   63:      option_order].
   64: 
   65: groups() -> 
   66:     [].
   67: 
   68: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   69:     test_lib:recompile(?MODULE),
   70:     Config.
   71: 
   72: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   73:     ok.
   74: 
   75: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   76: 	Config.
   77: 
   78: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   79: 	Config.
   80: 
   81: 
   82: 
   83: %% Test that the Application file has no `basic' errors.";
   84: app_test(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   85:     test_server:app_test(compiler).
   86: 
   87: %% Test that the Application upgrade file has no `basic' errors.";
   88: appup_test(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   89:     ok = test_server:appup_test(compiler).
   90: 
   91: %% Check that a file compiled to the abstract form and dumped with -E
   92: %% can be compiled. We use a file constructed to produce errors if the
   93: %% dumping fails to legalize compiler generated variable names.
   94: bigE_roundtrip(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   95:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
   96:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
   97:     Source = filename:join(DataDir, "bigE.erl"),
   98:     TargetDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "bigE"),
   99:     Target = filename:join(TargetDir, "bigE.E"),
  100:     TargetSource = filename:join(TargetDir, "bigE.erl"),
  101:     ok = file:make_dir(TargetDir),
  102:     io:format("Source: ~p~nTargetDir: ~p~nTarget: ~p\n",
  103:               [Source, TargetDir, Target]),
  104:     case compile:file(Source,
  105:                       ['E', warnings_as_errors, {outdir, TargetDir}]) of
  106:         {ok, _} -> ok;
  107:         Other -> ct:fail({unexpected_result, Other})
  108:     end,
  109:     %% Rename the output to .erl so that the compiler accepts it and
  110:     %% we won't get a warning due to the filename not matching the
  111:     %% module name.
  112:     ok = file:rename(Target, TargetSource),
  113:     case compile:file(TargetSource,
  114:                       [warnings_as_errors, {outdir, TargetDir}]) of
  115:         {ok, _} -> ok;
  116:         Other1 -> ct:fail({unexpected_result, Other1})
  117:     end,
  118:     file:delete(TargetSource),
  119:     file:del_dir(TargetDir),
  120:     ok.
  121: 
  122: %% Tests that we can compile and run a simple Erlang program,
  123: %% using compile:file/1.
  124: 
  125: file_1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  126:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  127: 
  128:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  129:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  130: 
  131:     {Simple, Target} = get_files(Config, simple, "file_1"),
  132:     {ok, Cwd} = file:get_cwd(),
  133:     ok = file:set_cwd(filename:dirname(Target)),
  134: 
  135:     {ok,simple} = compile:file(Simple, [slim]), %Smoke test only.
  136:     {ok,simple} = compile:file(Simple),	%Smoke test only.
  137: 
  138:     compile_and_verify(Simple, Target, []),
  139:     compile_and_verify(Simple, Target, [debug_info]),
  140:     compile_and_verify(Simple, Target, [no_postopt]),
  141: 
  142:     {ok,simple} = compile:file(Simple, [no_line_info]), %Coverage
  143:     {ok,simple} = compile:file(Simple, [{eprof,beam_z}]), %Coverage
  144:     {ok,simple} = compile:file(Simple, [{call_time,beam_z}]), %Coverage
  145:     {ok,simple} = compile:file(Simple, [{call_memory,beam_z}]), %Coverage
  146: 
  147:     %% Cover option not in a list (undocumented feature).
  148:     {ok,simple} = compile:file(Simple, no_postopt),
  149: 
  150:     %% Test compiling from an .abstr file.
  151:     {ok,[]} = compile:file(Simple, [dabstr]),
  152:     {ok,simple} = compile:file(filename:rootname(Target), [from_abstr]),
  153:     ok = file:delete(filename:rootname(Target) ++ ".abstr"),
  154: 
  155:     %% Test option 'deterministic'.
  156:     {ok,simple} = compile:file(Simple, [deterministic]),
  157:     {module,simple} = c:l(simple),
  158:     [{version,_}] = simple:module_info(compile),
  159:     true = code:delete(simple),
  160:     false = code:purge(simple),
  161: 
  162:     ok = file:set_cwd(Cwd),
  163:     true = exists(Target),
  164:     passed = run(Target, test, []),
  165: 
  166:     %% Test option 'deterministic' as a compiler attribute.
  167:     Det = deterministic_module,
  168:     {DetPath, DetTarget} = get_files(Config, Det, "det_target"),
  169:     {ok,Det,DetCode} = compile:file(DetPath, [binary]),
  170:     {module,Det} = code:load_binary(Det, "", DetCode),
  171:     [{version,_}] = Det:module_info(compile),
  172:     true = code:delete(Det),
  173:     false = code:purge(Det),
  174: 
  175:     %% Cover error handling code.
  176:     NonExisting = definitely__no__such__module,
  177:     error = compile:file(NonExisting, [report]),
  178:     error = compile:file(NonExisting, [from_abstr,report]),
  179:     error = compile:file(NonExisting, [from_core,report]),
  180:     error = compile:file(NonExisting, [from_asm,report]),
  181: 
  182:     error = compile:file(filename:join(DataDir, "bad_core"), [from_core,report]),
  183:     error = compile:file(filename:join(DataDir, "bad_core_tokens"), [from_core,report]),
  184: 
  185:     %% Cover handling of obsolete options.
  186:     ObsoleteOptions = [r18,r19,r20,r21,r22,r23,
  187:                        no_bsm3,no_get_hd_tl,no_put_tuple2,no_utf8_atoms,
  188:                        no_swap,no_init_yregs,no_shared_fun_wrappers,no_make_fun3],
  189:     _ = [begin
  190:              {error,[{_Simple,
  191:                       [{none,compile,{obsolete_option,Opt}}]}],
  192:               []} =
  193:                  compile:file(Simple, [Opt,return]),
  194:              error = compile:file(Simple, [Opt,report])
  195:          end || Opt <- ObsoleteOptions],
  196: 
  197:     %% Create a directory with the same name as the temp file to cover
  198:     %% handling of write errors.
  199:     Simple = filename:join(DataDir, "simple"),
  200:     SimpleTempFile = filename:join(PrivDir, "simple.bea#"),
  201:     SimpleOutputFile = filename:join(PrivDir, "simple.beam"),
  202:     ok = file:make_dir(SimpleTempFile),
  203:     ok = file:make_dir(SimpleOutputFile),
  204:     try
  205:         error = compile:file(Simple, [{outdir,PrivDir}, report]),
  206:         _ = file:del_dir(SimpleTempFile),
  207:         error = compile:file(Simple, [{outdir,PrivDir}, report])
  208:     after
  209:         _ = file:del_dir(SimpleTempFile),
  210:         _ = file:del_dir(SimpleOutputFile)
  211:     end,
  212: 
  213:     %% Cleanup.
  214:     ok = file:delete(Target),
  215:     ok = file:del_dir(filename:dirname(Target)),
  216:     ok = file:del_dir(filename:dirname(DetTarget)),
  217: 
  218:     %% There should not be any messages in the messages.
  219:     receive
  220: 	Any ->
  221: 	    ct:fail({unexpected,Any})
  222:     after 10 ->
  223: 	    ok
  224:     end,
  225: 
  226:     ok.
  227: 
  228: forms_2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  229:     {Simple, Target} = get_files(Config, simple, "file_1"),
  230:     ok = file:del_dir(filename:dirname(Target)),
  231: 
  232:     Src = Simple,
  233:     AbsSrc = filename:absname(Src),
  234:     {ok,[],SimpleCode} = compile:file(Simple, [dabstr,binary]),
  235: 
  236:     {ok,simple,Bin1} = compile:forms(SimpleCode, [binary,{source,Src}]),
  237:     {ok,simple,_} = compile:forms(SimpleCode,
  238:                                   [binary,{error_location,line},{source,Src}]),
  239: 
  240:     %% Cover option not in a list (undocumented feature).
  241:     {ok,simple,_} = compile:forms(SimpleCode, no_postopt),
  242: 
  243:     %% Load and test that the proper source is returned.
  244:     AbsSrc = forms_load_code(simple, Src, Bin1),
  245: 
  246:     %% Work in a deleted directory.
  247:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  248:     WorkDir = filename:join(PrivDir, ?FUNCTION_NAME),
  249:     ok = file:make_dir(WorkDir),
  250:     ok = file:set_cwd(WorkDir),
  251:     case os:type() of
  252: 	{unix,_} -> os:cmd("rm -rf " ++ WorkDir);
  253: 	_ -> ok
  254:     end,
  255:     {ok,simple,Bin2} = compile:forms(SimpleCode),
  256:     undefined = forms_load_code(simple, "ignore", Bin2),
  257: 
  258:     {ok,simple,Bin3} = compile:forms(SimpleCode, [{source,Src},report]),
  259:     case forms_load_code(simple, "ignore", Bin3) of
  260: 	Src ->					%Unix.
  261: 	    ok;
  262: 	AbsSrc ->				%Windows.
  263: 	    ok
  264:     end,
  265: 
  266:     {ok,simple,Core} = compile:forms(SimpleCode, [to_core0,binary]),
  267:     forms_compile_and_load(Core, [from_core]),
  268: 
  269:     {ok,simple,Asm} = compile:forms(SimpleCode, [to_asm,binary]),
  270:     forms_compile_and_load(Asm, [from_asm]),
  271: 
  272:     %% The `from_abstr` option is redundant when compiling from forms,
  273:     %% but it should work.
  274:     forms_compile_and_load(SimpleCode, [from_abstr]),
  275: 
  276:     %% Cover the error handling code.
  277:     error = compile:forms(bad_core, [from_core,report]),
  278:     error = compile:forms(bad_asm, [from_asm,report]),
  279: 
  280:     ok.
  281: 
  282: 
  283: forms_load_code(Mod, Src, Bin) ->
  284:     {module,Mod} = code:load_binary(Mod, Src, Bin),
  285:     Info = Mod:module_info(compile),
  286:     SourceOption = proplists:get_value(source, Info),
  287: 
  288:     %% Ensure that the options are not polluted with 'source'.
  289:     [] = proplists:get_value(options, Info),
  290: 
  291:     %% Cleanup.
  292:     true = code:delete(simple),
  293:     false = code:purge(simple),
  294: 
  295:     SourceOption.
  296: 
  297: forms_compile_and_load(Code, Opts) ->
  298:     Mod = simple,
  299:     {ok,Mod,Bin} = compile:forms(Code, Opts),
  300:     {module,Mod} = code:load_binary(Mod, "ignore", Bin),
  301:     _ = Mod:module_info(),
  302:     true = code:delete(simple),
  303:     false = code:purge(simple),
  304:     ok.
  305: 
  306: module_mismatch(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  307:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  308:     File = filename:join(DataDir, "wrong_module_name.erl"),
  309:     {error,[{"wrong_module_name.beam",
  310: 	     [{none,compile,{module_name,arne,"wrong_module_name"}}]}],
  311: 	   []} = compile:file(File, [return]),
  312:     error = compile:file(File, [report]),
  313: 
  314:     {ok,arne,[]} = compile:file(File,
  315: 				      [return,no_error_module_mismatch]),
  316: 
  317:     ok.
  318: 
  319: %% Tests that the {outdir, Dir} option works.
  320: 
  321: outdir(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  322:     {Simple, Target} = get_files(Config, simple, "outdir"),
  323:     {ok, simple} = compile:file(Simple, [{outdir, filename:dirname(Target)}]),
  324:     true = exists(Target),
  325:     passed = run(Target, test, []),
  326:     ok = file:delete(Target),
  327:     ok = file:del_dir(filename:dirname(Target)),
  328:     ok.
  329: 
  330: %% Tests that the binary option works.
  331: 
  332: binary(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  333:     {Simple, Target} = get_files(Config, simple, "binary"),
  334:     {ok, simple, Binary} = compile:file(Simple, [binary]),
  335:     code:load_binary(simple, Target, Binary),
  336:     passed = simple:test(),
  337:     true = code:delete(simple),
  338:     false = code:purge(simple),
  339:     ok = file:del_dir(filename:dirname(Target)),
  340:     ok.
  341: 
  342: %% Tests that the dependencies-Makefile-related options work.
  343: 
  344: makedep(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  345:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  346:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  347: 
  348:     {Simple,Target} = get_files(Config, simple, "makedep"),
  349:     SimpleRootname = filename:rootname(Simple),
  350:     IncludeDir = filename:join(filename:dirname(Simple), "include"),
  351:     IncludeOptions = [
  352: 		      {d,need_foo},
  353: 		      {d,foo_value,42},
  354: 		      {d,include_generated},
  355: 		      {i,IncludeDir}
  356: 		     ],
  357: 
  358:     %% Basic rule.
  359:     BasicMf1Name = SimpleRootname ++ "-basic1.mk",
  360:     {ok,BasicMf1} = file:read_file(BasicMf1Name),
  361:     {ok,_,Mf1} = compile:file(Simple, [binary,makedep]),
  362:     BasicMf1 = makedep_canonicalize_result(Mf1, DataDir),
  363: 
  364:     %% Basic rule with one existing header.
  365:     BasicMf2Name = SimpleRootname ++ "-basic2.mk",
  366:     {ok,BasicMf2} = file:read_file(BasicMf2Name),
  367:     {ok,_,Mf2} = compile:file(Simple, [binary,makedep|IncludeOptions]),
  368:     BasicMf2 = makedep_canonicalize_result(Mf2, DataDir),
  369: 
  370:     %% Rule with one existing header and one missing header.
  371:     MissingMfName = SimpleRootname ++ "-missing.mk",
  372:     {ok,MissingMf} = file:read_file(MissingMfName),
  373:     {ok,_,Mf3} = compile:file(Simple,
  374:       [binary,makedep,makedep_add_missing|IncludeOptions]),
  375:     MissingMf = makedep_canonicalize_result(Mf3, DataDir),
  376: 
  377:     %% Rule with modified target.
  378:     TargetMf1Name = SimpleRootname ++ "-target1.mk",
  379:     {ok,TargetMf1} = file:read_file(TargetMf1Name),
  380:     {ok,_,Mf4} = compile:file(Simple,
  381:       [binary,makedep,{makedep_target,"$target"}|IncludeOptions]),
  382:     TargetMf1 = makedep_modify_target(
  383:       makedep_canonicalize_result(Mf4, DataDir), "$$target"),
  384: 
  385:     %% Rule with quoted modified target.
  386:     TargetMf2Name = SimpleRootname ++ "-target2.mk",
  387:     {ok,TargetMf2} = file:read_file(TargetMf2Name),
  388:     {ok,_,Mf5} = compile:file(Simple,
  389:       [binary,makedep,{makedep_target,"$target"},makedep_quote_target|
  390:         IncludeOptions]),
  391:     TargetMf2 = makedep_modify_target(
  392:       makedep_canonicalize_result(Mf5, DataDir), "$$target"),
  393: 
  394:     %% Basic rule written to some file.
  395:     {ok,_} = compile:file(Simple,
  396:       [makedep,{makedep_output,Target}|IncludeOptions]),
  397:     {ok,Mf6} = file:read_file(Target),
  398:     BasicMf2 = makedep_canonicalize_result(Mf6, DataDir),
  399: 
  400:     %% Rule with creating phony target.
  401:     PhonyMfName = SimpleRootname ++ "-phony.mk",
  402:     {ok,PhonyMf} = file:read_file(PhonyMfName),
  403:     {ok,_,Mf7} = compile:file(Simple,
  404:       [binary,makedep,makedep_phony|IncludeOptions]),
  405:     PhonyMf = makedep_canonicalize_result(Mf7, DataDir),
  406: 
  407:     %% Basic rule written to the default file.
  408:     {ok,_} = compile:file(Simple, [makedep|IncludeOptions]),
  409:     {ok,Mf8} = file:read_file(Target),
  410:     BasicMf2 = makedep_canonicalize_result(Mf8, DataDir),
  411: 
  412:     %% Generate dependencies and compile normally at the same time.
  413:     GeneratedHrl = filename:join(PrivDir, "generated.hrl"),
  414:     GeneratedDoc = filename:join(proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config), "foo.md"),
  415:     try
  416:         ok = file:write_file(GeneratedHrl, ""),
  417:         ok = file:write_file(GeneratedDoc, ""),
  418:         {ok,simple} = compile:file(Simple, [report,makedep_side_effect,
  419:                                             {makedep_output,Target},
  420:                                             {i,PrivDir}|IncludeOptions]),
  421:         {ok,Mf9} = file:read_file(Target),
  422:         BasicMf3 = iolist_to_binary([string:trim(BasicMf2), " $(srcdir)/foo.md ", filename:join(PrivDir, "generated.hrl"), "\n"]),
  423:         BasicMf3 = makedep_canonicalize_result(Mf9, DataDir),
  424:         error = compile:file(Simple, [report,makedep_side_effect,
  425:                                       {makedep_output,PrivDir}|IncludeOptions])
  426:     after
  427:         ok = file:delete(GeneratedHrl),
  428:         ok = file:delete(GeneratedDoc)
  429:     end,
  430: 
  431:     %% Cover generation of long lines that must be split.
  432:     CompileModule = filename:join(code:lib_dir(compiler), "src/compile.erl"),
  433:     {ok,_} = compile:file(CompileModule, [report,
  434:                                           makedep,{makedep_output,standard_io},
  435:                                           {i,filename:join(code:lib_dir(stdlib), "include")}]),
  436: 
  437:     %% Basic rule written to the standard output.
  438:     {ok,_} = compile:file(Simple, [makedep,{makedep_output,standard_io}|IncludeOptions]),
  439: 
  440:     %% Test error handling.
  441:     error = compile:file(Simple, [report,makedep,{makedep_output,DataDir}]),
  442:     error = compile:file(Simple, [report,makedep,{makedep_output,a_bad_output_device}]),
  443: 
  444:     ok = file:delete(Target),
  445:     ok = file:del_dir(filename:dirname(Target)),
  446:     ok.
  447: 
  448: makedep_canonicalize_result(Mf, DataDir) ->
  449:     Mf0 = binary_to_list(Mf),
  450:     %% Replace the Datadir by "$(srcdir)".
  451:     Mf1 = re:replace(Mf0, DataDir, "$(srcdir)/",
  452:       [global,multiline,{return,list}]),
  453:     %% Long lines are split, put back everything on one line.
  454:     Mf2 = re:replace(Mf1, "\\\\\n  ", "", [global,multiline,{return,list}]),
  455:     list_to_binary(Mf2).
  456: 
  457: makedep_modify_target(Mf, Target) ->
  458:     Mf0 = binary_to_list(Mf),
  459:     Mf1 = re:replace(Mf0, Target, "$target", [{return,list}]),
  460:     list_to_binary(Mf1).
  461: 
  462: %% Tests that conditional compilation, defining values, including files work.
  463: 
  464: no_core_prepare(_Config) ->
  465:     Mod = {c_module,[],
  466:               {c_literal,[],sample_receive},
  467:               [{c_var,[],{discard,0}}],
  468:               [],
  469:               [{{c_var,[],{discard,0}},
  470:                 {c_fun,[],[],
  471:                     {c_case,[],
  472:                         {c_values,[],[]},
  473:                         [{c_clause,[],[],
  474:                              {c_literal,[],true},
  475:                              {c_receive,[],[],{c_literal,[],0},{c_literal,[],ok}}}]}}}]},
  476: 
  477:     {ok,sample_receive,_,_} = compile:forms(Mod, [from_core,binary,return]),
  478:     {error,_,_} = compile:forms(Mod, [from_core,binary,return,no_core_prepare]),
  479:     ok.
  480: 
  481: cond_and_ifdef(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  482:     {Simple, Target} = get_files(Config, simple, "cond_and_ifdef"),
  483:     IncludeDir = filename:join(filename:dirname(Simple), "include"),
  484:     Options = [{outdir, filename:dirname(Target)},
  485: 		     {d, need_foo}, {d, foo_value, 42},
  486: 		     {i, IncludeDir}, report],
  487:     {ok, simple} = compile:file(Simple, Options),
  488:     true = exists(Target),
  489:     {hiker, 42} = run(Target, foo, []),
  490:     ok = file:delete(Target),
  491:     ok = file:del_dir(filename:dirname(Target)),
  492:     ok.
  493: 
  494: listings(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  495:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  496:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  497:     ok = do_file_listings(DataDir, PrivDir, [
  498: 	    "simple",
  499: 	    "small",
  500: 	    "small_maps"
  501: 	]),
  502: 
  503:     %% Cover handling of write errors.
  504:     Simple = filename:join(DataDir, "simple"),
  505:     SimpleTarget = filename:join(PrivDir, "simple.S"),
  506:     ok = file:make_dir(SimpleTarget),
  507:     try
  508:         error = compile:file(Simple, ['S', {outdir,PrivDir}, report])
  509:     after
  510:         ok = file:del_dir(SimpleTarget)
  511:     end,
  512: 
  513:     ok.
  514: 
  515: do_file_listings(_, _, []) -> ok;
  516: do_file_listings(DataDir, PrivDir, [File|Files]) ->
  517:     Simple = filename:join(DataDir, File),
  518:     TargetDir = filename:join(PrivDir, listings),
  519:     ok = file:make_dir(TargetDir),
  520: 
  521:     List = [{'S',".S"},
  522:             {'E',".E"},
  523:             {'P',".P"},
  524:             {dpp, ".pp"},
  525:             {dabstr, ".abstr"},
  526:             {dexp, ".expand"},
  527:             {dcore, ".core"},
  528:             {doldinline, ".oldinline"},
  529:             {dinline, ".inline"},
  530:             {dcore, ".core"},
  531:             {dcopt, ".copt"},
  532:             {dcbsm, ".core_bsm"},
  533:             {dssa, ".ssa"},
  534:             {dbool, ".bool"},
  535:             {dssashare, ".ssashare"},
  536:             {dssaopt, ".ssaopt"},
  537:             {dprecg, ".precodegen"},
  538:             {dcg, ".codegen"},
  539:             {dblk, ".block"},
  540:             {djmp, ".jump"},
  541:             {dclean, ".clean"},
  542:             {dopt, ".optimize"},
  543:             {diffable, ".S"}],
  544:     p_listings(List, Simple, TargetDir),
  545: 
  546:     %% Test options that produce a listing file if 'binary' is not given.
  547:     do_listing(Simple, TargetDir, to_pp, ".P"),
  548:     do_listing(Simple, TargetDir, to_exp, ".E"),
  549:     do_listing(Simple, TargetDir, to_core0, ".core"),
  550:     ok = file:delete(filename:join(TargetDir, File ++ ".core")),
  551:     do_listing(Simple, TargetDir, to_core, ".core"),
  552:     do_listing(Simple, TargetDir, to_dis, ".dis"),
  553: 
  554:     %% Final clean up.
  555:     lists:foreach(fun(F) -> ok = file:delete(F) end,
  556: 	filelib:wildcard(filename:join(TargetDir, "*"))),
  557:     ok = file:del_dir(TargetDir),
  558: 
  559:     do_file_listings(DataDir,PrivDir,Files).
  560: 
  561: listings_big(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  562:     {Big,Target} = get_files(Config, big, listings_big),
  563:     TargetDir = filename:dirname(Target),
  564:     List = [{'S',".S"},
  565:             {'E',".E"},
  566:             {'P',".P"},
  567:             {dssa, ".ssa"},
  568:             {dssaopt, ".ssaopt"},
  569:             {dprecg, ".precodegen"},
  570:             {to_dis, ".dis"}],
  571:     p_listings(List, Big, TargetDir).
  572: 
  573: p_listings(List, File, BaseDir) ->
  574:     Run = fun({Option,Extension}) ->
  575:                   Uniq = erlang:unique_integer([positive]),
  576:                   Dir = filename:join(BaseDir, integer_to_list(Uniq)),
  577:                   ok = file:make_dir(Dir),
  578:                   try
  579:                       do_listing(File, Dir, Option, Extension),
  580:                       ok
  581:                   catch
  582:                       Class:Error:Stk ->
  583:                           io:format("~p:~p\n~p\n", [Class,Error,Stk]),
  584:                           error
  585:                   after
  586:                       _ = [ok = file:delete(F) ||
  587:                               F <- filelib:wildcard(filename:join(Dir, "*"))],
  588:                       ok = file:del_dir(Dir)
  589:                   end
  590:           end,
  591:     test_lib:p_run(Run, List).
  592: 
  593: other_output(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  594:     {Simple,_Target} = get_files(Config, simple, "other_output"),
  595: 
  596:     io:put_chars("to_pp"),
  597:     {ok,[],PP} = compile:file(Simple, [to_pp,binary,time]),
  598:     [] = [E || E <- PP,
  599: 	       begin
  600: 		   case element(1, E) of
  601: 		       attribute -> false;
  602: 		       function -> false;
  603: 		       eof -> false
  604: 		   end
  605: 	       end],
  606: 
  607:     io:put_chars("to_exp (file)"),
  608:     {ok,[],Expand} = compile:file(Simple, [to_exp,binary,time]),
  609:     true = is_list(Expand),
  610:     {attribute,_,module,simple} = lists:keyfind(module, 3, Expand),
  611:     io:put_chars("to_exp (forms)"),
  612:     {ok,[],Expand} = compile:forms(PP, [to_exp,binary,time]),
  613: 
  614:     io:put_chars("to_core (file)"),
  615:     {ok,simple,Core} = compile:file(Simple, [to_core,binary,time]),
  616:     c_module = element(1, Core),
  617:     {ok,_} = core_lint:module(Core),
  618:     io:put_chars("to_core (forms)"),
  619:     {ok,simple,Core} = compile:forms(PP, [to_core,binary,time]),
  620: 
  621:     io:put_chars("to_asm (file)"),
  622:     {ok,simple,Asm} = compile:file(Simple, [to_asm,binary,time]),
  623:     {simple,_,_,_,_} = Asm,
  624:     io:put_chars("to_asm (forms)"),
  625:     {ok,simple,Asm} = compile:forms(PP, [to_asm,binary,time]),
  626: 
  627:     ok.
  628: 
  629: encrypted_abstr(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  630:     {Simple,Target} = get_files(Config, simple, "encrypted_abstr"),
  631: 
  632:     Res = case has_crypto() of
  633: 	      false ->
  634: 		  %% No crypto.
  635: 		  encrypted_abstr_no_crypto(Simple, Target),
  636: 		  {comment,"The crypto application is missing or broken"};
  637: 	      true ->
  638: 		  %% Simulate not having crypto by removing
  639: 		  %% the crypto application from the path.
  640: 		  OldPath = code:get_path(),
  641: 		  try
  642: 		      NewPath = OldPath -- [filename:dirname(code:which(crypto))],
  643: 		      (catch crypto:stop()),
  644: 		      code:delete(crypto),
  645: 		      code:purge(crypto),
  646: 		      code:set_path(NewPath),
  647: 		      encrypted_abstr_no_crypto(Simple, Target)
  648: 		      after
  649: 			  code:set_path(OldPath)
  650: 		      end,
  651: 
  652: 		  %% Now run the tests that require crypto.
  653: 		  encrypted_abstr_1(Simple, Target),
  654: 		  ok = file:delete(Target),
  655: 		  _ = file:del_dir_r(filename:dirname(Target))
  656: 	  end,
  657:     
  658:     %% Cleanup.
  659:     Res.
  660: 
  661: encrypted_abstr_1(Simple, Target) ->
  662:     TargetDir = filename:dirname(Target),
  663:     Key = "ablurf123BX#$;3",
  664:     install_crypto_key(Key),
  665:     {ok,simple} = compile:file(Simple,
  666: 				     [debug_info,{debug_info_key,Key},
  667: 				      {outdir,TargetDir}]),
  668:     verify_abstract(Target, erl_abstract_code),
  669: 
  670:     {ok,simple} = compile:file(Simple,
  671: 				     [{debug_info_key,Key},
  672: 				      {outdir,TargetDir}]),
  673:     verify_abstract(Target, erl_abstract_code),
  674: 
  675:     {ok,simple} = compile:file(Simple,
  676: 				     [debug_info,{debug_info_key,{des3_cbc,Key}},
  677: 				      {outdir,TargetDir}]),
  678:     verify_abstract(Target, erl_abstract_code),
  679: 
  680:     {ok,simple} = compile:file(Simple,
  681: 				     [{debug_info,{?MODULE,ok}},
  682: 				      {debug_info_key,Key},
  683: 				      {outdir,TargetDir}]),
  684:     verify_abstract(Target, ?MODULE),
  685: 
  686:     {ok,{simple,[{compile_info,CInfo}]}} =
  687: 	beam_lib:chunks(Target, [compile_info]),
  688:     {_,Opts} = lists:keyfind(options, 1, CInfo),
  689:     {_,'********'} = lists:keyfind(debug_info_key, 1, Opts),
  690: 
  691:     %% Try some illegal forms of crypto keys.
  692:     error = compile:file(Simple,
  693: 			       [debug_info,{debug_info_key,{blurf,"ss"}},report]),
  694:     error = compile:file(Simple,
  695: 			       [debug_info,{debug_info_key,{blurf,1,"ss"}},report]),
  696:     error = compile:file(Simple,
  697: 			       [debug_info,{debug_info_key,42},report]),
  698: 
  699:     beam_lib:clear_crypto_key_fun(),
  700: 
  701:     %% Test to place the crypto file on disk. The test is dependent on the
  702:     %% $HOME of the emulator, so we do this test in another node.
  703:     TestHome = filename:join(TargetDir, "home"),
  704:     filelib:ensure_dir(TestHome),
  705:     HomeEnv = case os:type() of
  706:                   {win32, _} ->
  707:                       [Drive | Path] = filename:split(TestHome),
  708:                       [{"APPDATA", filename:join(TestHome,"AppData")},
  709:                        {"HOMEDRIVE", Drive}, {"HOMEPATH", filename:join(Path)}];
  710:                   _ ->
  711:                       [{"HOME", TestHome}]
  712:               end,
  713: 
  714:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(#{ env => HomeEnv }),
  715: 
  716:     erpc:call(
  717:       Node,
  718:       fun() ->
  719:               ok = file:set_cwd(TargetDir),
  720: 
  721:               error = compile:file(Simple, [encrypt_debug_info,report]),
  722: 
  723:               CWDKey = "better use another key here",
  724:               CWDFile = ".erlang.crypt",
  725:               XDGKey = "better use yet another key here",
  726:               XDGFile = filename:join(
  727:                           filename:basedir(user_config,"erlang"),
  728:                           ".erlang.crypt"),
  729:               HOMEKey = "better use the home key here",
  730:               HOMEFile = filename:join(TestHome,".erlang.crypt"),
  731: 
  732:               write_crypt_file(CWDFile, CWDKey),
  733:               write_crypt_file(XDGFile, XDGKey),
  734:               write_crypt_file(HOMEFile, HOMEKey),
  735: 
  736:               %% First we test that .erlang.crypt in cwd works
  737:               {ok,simple} = compile:file(Simple, [encrypt_debug_info,report]),
  738:               verify_abstract("simple.beam", erl_abstract_code),
  739:               ok = file:delete(CWDFile),
  740:               beam_lib:clear_crypto_key_fun(),
  741: 
  742:               %% Then we test that .erlang.crypt in HOME does **not** work
  743:               {error,beam_lib,{key_missing_or_invalid,"simple.beam",abstract_code}} =
  744:                   beam_lib:chunks("simple.beam", [abstract_code]),
  745: 
  746:               %% Then we test that .erlang.crypt in HOME does work
  747:               {ok,simple} = compile:file(Simple, [encrypt_debug_info,report]),
  748:               verify_abstract("simple.beam", erl_abstract_code),
  749:               ok = file:delete(HOMEFile),
  750:               beam_lib:clear_crypto_key_fun(),
  751: 
  752:               %% Then we test that .erlang.crypt in XDG does **not** work
  753:               {error,beam_lib,{key_missing_or_invalid,"simple.beam",abstract_code}} =
  754:                   beam_lib:chunks("simple.beam", [abstract_code]),
  755: 
  756: 
  757:               %% Then we test that .erlang.crypt in XDG does work
  758:               {ok,simple} = compile:file(Simple, [encrypt_debug_info,report]),
  759:               verify_abstract("simple.beam", erl_abstract_code),
  760:               ok = file:delete(XDGFile),
  761: 
  762:               beam_lib:clear_crypto_key_fun(),
  763:               {error,beam_lib,{key_missing_or_invalid,"simple.beam",abstract_code}} =
  764:                   beam_lib:chunks("simple.beam", [abstract_code])
  765: 
  766:       end),
  767: 
  768:     peer:stop(Peer),
  769: 
  770:     %% Test key compatibility by reading a BEAM file produced before
  771:     %% the update to the new crypto functions.
  772:     install_crypto_key("an old key"),
  773:     KeyCompat = filename:join(filename:dirname(Simple),
  774: 			      "key_compatibility"),
  775:     {ok,{key_compatibility,[Chunk]}} = beam_lib:chunks(KeyCompat,
  776: 						       [abstract_code]),
  777:     {abstract_code,{raw_abstract_v1,_}} = Chunk,
  778: 
  779:     ok.
  780: 
  781: write_crypt_file(File, Key) ->
  782:     Contents = ["[{debug_info,des3_cbc,simple,\"",Key,"\"}].\n"],
  783:     io:format("~s: ~s\n", [File, Contents]),
  784:     ok = filelib:ensure_dir(File),
  785:     ok = file:write_file(File, Contents).
  786: 
  787: encrypted_abstr_no_crypto(Simple, Target) ->
  788:     io:format("simpe: ~p~n", [Simple]),
  789:     TargetDir = filename:dirname(Target),
  790:     Key = "ablurf123BX#$;3",
  791:     error = compile:file(Simple,
  792: 			       [debug_info,{debug_info_key,Key},
  793: 				{outdir,TargetDir},report]),
  794:     ok.
  795:     
  796: verify_abstract(Beam, Backend) ->
  797:     {ok,{simple,[Abst, Dbgi]}} = beam_lib:chunks(Beam, [abstract_code, debug_info]),
  798:     {abstract_code,{raw_abstract_v1,_}} = Abst,
  799:     {debug_info,{debug_info_v1,Backend,_}} = Dbgi.
  800: 
  801: has_crypto() ->
  802:     try
  803: 	crypto:start(),
  804: 	crypto:stop(),
  805: 	true
  806:     catch
  807: 	error:_ -> false
  808:     end.
  809: 
  810: install_crypto_key(Key) ->
  811:     F = fun (init) -> ok;
  812: 	    ({debug_info,des3_cbc,_,_}) -> Key;
  813: 	    (clear) -> ok
  814: 	end,
  815:     ok = beam_lib:crypto_key_fun(F).
  816: 
  817: %% Miscellaneous tests, mainly to get better coverage.
  818: debug_info(erlang_v1, Module, ok, _Opts) ->
  819:     {ok, [Module]};
  820: debug_info(erlang_v1, _Module, error, _Opts) ->
  821:     {error, unknown_format}.
  822: 
  823: custom_debug_info(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  824:     {Simple,_} = get_files(Config, simple, "file_1"),
  825: 
  826:     {ok,simple,OkBin} = compile:file(Simple, [binary, {debug_info,{?MODULE,ok}}]), %Coverage
  827:     {ok,{simple,[{abstract_code,{raw_abstract_v1,[simple]}}]}} =
  828: 	beam_lib:chunks(OkBin, [abstract_code]),
  829:     {ok,{simple,[{debug_info,{debug_info_v1,?MODULE,ok}}]}} =
  830: 	beam_lib:chunks(OkBin, [debug_info]),
  831: 
  832:     {ok,simple,ErrorBin} = compile:file(Simple, [binary, {debug_info,{?MODULE,error}}]), %Coverage
  833:     {ok,{simple,[{abstract_code,no_abstract_code}]}} =
  834: 	beam_lib:chunks(ErrorBin, [abstract_code]),
  835:     {ok,{simple,[{debug_info,{debug_info_v1,?MODULE,error}}]}} =
  836: 	beam_lib:chunks(ErrorBin, [debug_info]).
  837: 
  838: custom_compile_info(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  839:     Anno = erl_anno:new(1),
  840:     Forms = [{attribute,Anno,module,custom_compile_info}],
  841:     Opts = [binary,{compile_info,[{another,version}]}],
  842: 
  843:     {ok,custom_compile_info,Bin} = compile:forms(Forms, Opts),
  844:     {ok,{custom_compile_info,[{compile_info,CompileInfo}]}} =
  845: 	beam_lib:chunks(Bin, [compile_info]),
  846:     version = proplists:get_value(another, CompileInfo),
  847:     CompileOpts = proplists:get_value(options, CompileInfo),
  848:     undefined = proplists:get_value(compile_info, CompileOpts),
  849: 
  850:     {ok,custom_compile_info,DetBin} = compile:forms(Forms, [deterministic|Opts]),
  851:     {ok,{custom_compile_info,[{compile_info,DetInfo}]}} =
  852: 	beam_lib:chunks(DetBin, [compile_info]),
  853:     version = proplists:get_value(another, DetInfo).
  854: 
  855: cover(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  856:     io:format("~p\n", [compile:options()]),
  857:     ok.
  858: 
  859: do_listing(Source, TargetDir, Type, Ext) ->
  860:     io:format("Source: ~p TargetDir: ~p\n  Type: ~p Ext: ~p\n",
  861: 	      [Source, TargetDir, Type, Ext]),
  862:     case compile:file(Source, [Type, time, {outdir, TargetDir}]) of
  863: 	{ok, _} -> ok;
  864: 	Other -> ct:fail({unexpected_result, Other})
  865:     end,
  866:     SourceBase = filename:rootname(filename:basename(Source)),
  867: 
  868:     Target = filename:join(TargetDir, SourceBase ++ Ext),
  869:     true = exists(Target).
  870: 
  871: get_files(Config, Module, OutputName) ->
  872:     code:delete(Module),
  873:     code:purge(Module),
  874:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  875:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  876:     Src = filename:join(DataDir, atom_to_list(Module)),
  877:     TargetDir = filename:join(PrivDir, OutputName),
  878:     ok = file:make_dir(TargetDir),
  879:     File = atom_to_list(Module) ++ code:objfile_extension(),
  880:     Target = filename:join(TargetDir, File),
  881:     {Src, Target}.
  882: 
  883: run(Target, Func, Args) ->
  884:     Module = list_to_atom(filename:rootname(filename:basename(Target))),
  885:     {module, Module} = code:load_abs(filename:rootname(Target)),
  886:     Result = (catch apply(Module, Func, Args)),
  887:     true = code:delete(Module),
  888:     false = code:purge(Module),
  889:     Result.
  890: 
  891: exists(Name) ->
  892:     case file:read_file_info(Name) of
  893: 	{ok, _}    -> true;
  894: 	{error, _} -> false
  895:     end.
  896: 
  897: 
  898: strict_record(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  899:     Priv = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  900:     ok = file:set_cwd(proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config)),
  901:     Opts = [{outdir,Priv},report_errors],
  902:     M = record_access,
  903:  
  904:     {ok,M} = c:c(M, [strict_record_tests|Opts]),
  905:     Turtle = test_strict(),
  906: 
  907:     {ok,M} = c:c(M, [no_strict_record_tests|Opts]),
  908:     Turtle = test_sloppy(),
  909: 
  910:     %% The option last given wins.
  911:     {ok,M} = c:c(M, [strict_record_tests,no_strict_record_tests|Opts]),
  912:     Turtle = test_sloppy(),
  913:     {ok,M} = c:c(M, [no_strict_record_tests,strict_record_tests|Opts]),
  914:     Turtle = test_strict(),
  915: 
  916:     %% Default (possibly influenced by ERL_COMPILER_OPTIONS).
  917:     {ok,M} = c:c(M, [{outdir,Priv},report_errors]),
  918:     try
  919:         {1,2} = record_access:test(Turtle),
  920:         {comment,"Default: no_strict_record_tests"}
  921:     catch
  922:         error:{badrecord,Turtle} ->
  923:             {comment,"Default: strict_record_tests"}
  924:     end.
  925: 
  926: test_strict() ->
  927:     Turtle = record_access:turtle(),
  928:     try
  929:         record_access:test(Turtle)
  930:     catch
  931:         error:{badrecord,Turtle} ->
  932:             ok
  933:     end,
  934:     Turtle.
  935: 
  936: test_sloppy() ->
  937:     Turtle = record_access:turtle(),
  938:     {1,2} = record_access:test(Turtle),
  939:     Turtle.
  940: 
  941: utf8_atoms(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  942:     Anno = erl_anno:new(1),
  943:     Atom = binary_to_atom(<<""/utf8>>, utf8),
  944:     Forms = [{attribute,Anno,compile,[export_all]},
  945: 	     {function,Anno,atom,0,[{clause,Anno,[],[],[{atom,Anno,Atom}]}]}],
  946: 
  947:     Utf8AtomForms = [{attribute,Anno,module,utf8_atom}|Forms],
  948:     {ok,utf8_atom,Utf8AtomBin} =
  949: 	compile:forms(Utf8AtomForms, [binary]),
  950:     {ok,{utf8_atom,[{atoms,_}]}} =
  951: 	beam_lib:chunks(Utf8AtomBin, [atoms]),
  952:     code:load_binary(utf8_atom, "compile_SUITE", Utf8AtomBin),
  953:     Atom = utf8_atom:atom(),
  954:     true = is_atom(Atom),
  955:     ok.
  956: 
  957: utf8_functions(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  958:     Anno = erl_anno:new(1),
  959:     Atom = binary_to_atom(<<""/utf8>>, utf8),
  960:     Forms = [{attribute,Anno,compile,[export_all]},
  961: 	     {function,Anno,Atom,0,[{clause,Anno,[],[],[{atom,Anno,world}]}]}],
  962: 
  963:     Utf8FunctionForms = [{attribute,Anno,module,utf8_function}|Forms],
  964:     {ok,utf8_function,Utf8FunctionBin} =
  965: 	compile:forms(Utf8FunctionForms, [binary]),
  966:     {ok,{utf8_function,[{atoms,_}]}} =
  967: 	beam_lib:chunks(Utf8FunctionBin, [atoms]),
  968:     code:load_binary(utf8_function, "compile_SUITE", Utf8FunctionBin),
  969:     world = utf8_function:Atom(),
  970: 
  971:     NoUtf8FunctionForms = [{attribute,Anno,module,no_utf8_function}|Forms],
  972:     error = compile:forms(NoUtf8FunctionForms, [binary, r19]).
  973: 
  974: extra_chunks(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  975:     Anno = erl_anno:new(1),
  976:     Forms = [{attribute,Anno,module,extra_chunks}],
  977: 
  978:     {ok,extra_chunks,ExtraChunksBinary} =
  979: 	compile:forms(Forms, [binary, {extra_chunks, [{<<"ExCh">>, <<"Contents">>}]}]),
  980:     {ok,{extra_chunks,[{"ExCh",<<"Contents">>}]}} =
  981: 	beam_lib:chunks(ExtraChunksBinary, ["ExCh"]).
  982: 
  983: tuple_calls(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  984:     Anno = erl_anno:new(1),
  985:     Forms = [{attribute,Anno,export,[{size,1},{store,1}]},
  986: 	     {function,Anno,size,1,
  987: 	      [{clause,Anno,[{var,Anno,mod}],[],
  988: 	       [{call,Anno,{remote,Anno,{var,Anno,mod},{atom,Anno,size}},
  989:                  []}]}]},
  990: 	     {function,Anno,store,1,
  991: 	      [{clause,Anno,[{var,Anno,mod}],[],
  992: 	       [{call,Anno,{remote,Anno,{var,Anno,mod},{atom,Anno,store}},
  993:                  [{atom,Anno,key},{atom,Anno,value}]}]}]}],
  994: 
  995:     TupleCallsFalse = [{attribute,Anno,module,tuple_calls_false}|Forms],
  996:     {ok,_,TupleCallsFalseBinary} = compile:forms(TupleCallsFalse, [binary]),
  997:     code:load_binary(tuple_calls_false, "compile_SUITE.erl", TupleCallsFalseBinary),
  998:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch tuple_calls_false:store(dict())),
  999:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch tuple_calls_false:size(dict())),
 1000:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch tuple_calls_false:size(empty_tuple())),
 1001: 
 1002:     TupleCallsTrue = [{attribute,Anno,module,tuple_calls_true}|Forms],
 1003:     {ok,_,TupleCallsTrueBinary} = compile:forms(TupleCallsTrue, [binary,tuple_calls]),
 1004:     code:load_binary(tuple_calls_true, "compile_SUITE.erl", TupleCallsTrueBinary),
 1005:     Dict = tuple_calls_true:store(dict()),
 1006:     1 = tuple_calls_true:size(Dict),
 1007:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch tuple_calls_true:size(empty_tuple())),
 1008: 
 1009:     ok.
 1010: 
 1011: dict() ->
 1012:     dict:new().
 1013: empty_tuple() ->
 1014:     {}.
 1015: 
 1016: env(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1017:     {Simple,Target} = get_files(Config, simple, env),
 1018:     {ok,Cwd} = file:get_cwd(),
 1019:     ok = file:set_cwd(filename:dirname(Target)),
 1020: 
 1021:     true = os:putenv("ERL_COMPILER_OPTIONS", "binary"),
 1022:     try
 1023: 	env_1(Simple, Target)
 1024:     after
 1025: 	true = os:putenv("ERL_COMPILER_OPTIONS", "ignore_me"),
 1026: 	file:set_cwd(Cwd),
 1027: 	file:delete(Target),
 1028: 	file:del_dir(filename:dirname(Target))
 1029:     end,
 1030:     ok.
 1031: 
 1032: env_1(Simple, Target) ->
 1033:     %% file
 1034:     {ok,simple,<<_/binary>>} = compile:file(Simple),
 1035:     {ok,simple} = compile:noenv_file(Simple, [debug_info]),
 1036:     {ok,simple} = compile:noenv_file(Simple, debug_info),
 1037: 
 1038:     true = exists(Target),
 1039:     {ok,{simple,[{abstract_code,Abstr0}]}} =
 1040: 	beam_lib:chunks(Target, [abstract_code]),
 1041:     {raw_abstract_v1,Forms} = Abstr0,
 1042: 
 1043:     %% forms
 1044:     true = os:putenv("ERL_COMPILER_OPTIONS", "strong_validation"),
 1045:     {ok,simple} = compile:forms(Forms),
 1046:     {ok,simple,<<"FOR1",_/binary>>} = compile:noenv_forms(Forms, []),
 1047: 
 1048:     %% output_generated
 1049:     false = compile:output_generated([]),
 1050:     true = compile:noenv_output_generated([]),
 1051: 
 1052:     ok = file:delete(Target),
 1053: 
 1054:     %% Cover error handling.
 1055:     true = os:putenv("ERL_COMPILER_OPTIONS", "'unterminated_atom"),
 1056:     {ok,[]} = compile:forms(Forms, [basic_validation]),
 1057:     true = os:putenv("ERL_COMPILER_OPTIONS", ",,,"),
 1058:     {ok,[]} = compile:forms(Forms, [basic_validation]),
 1059:     {ok,simple,<<"FOR1",_/binary>>} = compile:noenv_forms(Forms, no_postopt),
 1060: 
 1061:     ok.
 1062: 
 1063: %% Test pretty-printing in Core Erlang format and then try to
 1064: %% compile the generated Core Erlang files.
 1065: 
 1066: core_pp(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1067:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1068:     Outdir = filename:join(PrivDir, atom_to_list(?FUNCTION_NAME)),
 1069:     ok = file:make_dir(Outdir),
 1070: 
 1071:     TestBeams = get_unique_beam_files(),
 1072:     Abstr = [begin {ok,{Mod,[{abstract_code,
 1073: 				    {raw_abstract_v1,Abstr}}]}} = 
 1074: 			     beam_lib:chunks(Beam, [abstract_code]),
 1075: 			 {Mod,Abstr} end || Beam <- TestBeams],
 1076:     test_lib:p_run(fun(F) -> do_core_pp(F, Outdir) end, Abstr).
 1077:     
 1078: do_core_pp({M,A}, Outdir) ->
 1079:     try
 1080: 	do_core_pp_1(M, A, Outdir)
 1081:     catch
 1082: 	throw:{error,Error} ->
 1083: 	    io:format("*** compilation failure '~p' for module ~s\n",
 1084: 		      [Error,M]),
 1085: 	    error;
 1086: 	Class:Error:Stk ->
 1087: 	    io:format("~p: ~p ~p\n~p\n", [M,Class,Error,Stk]),
 1088: 	    error
 1089:     end.
 1090: 
 1091: do_core_pp_1(M, A, Outdir) ->
 1092:     {ok,M,Core0} = compile:forms(A, [to_core]),
 1093:     CoreFile = filename:join(Outdir, atom_to_list(M)++".core"),
 1094:     CorePP = core_pp:format(Core0),
 1095:     ok = file:write_file(CoreFile, unicode:characters_to_binary(CorePP)),
 1096: 
 1097:     %% Parse the .core file and return the result as Core Erlang Terms.
 1098:     Core = case compile:file(CoreFile, [report_errors,from_core,no_copt,to_core,binary]) of
 1099: 	       {ok,M,Core1} -> Core1;
 1100: 	       Other -> throw({error,Other})
 1101: 	   end,
 1102:     ok = file:delete(CoreFile),
 1103: 
 1104:     %% Compile as usual (including optimizations).
 1105:     compile_forms(M, Core, [clint,ssalint,from_core,binary]),
 1106: 
 1107:     %% Don't optimize to test that we are not dependent
 1108:     %% on the Core Erlang optimization passes.
 1109:     %% (Example of a previous bug: The core_parse pass
 1110:     %% would not turn map literals into #c_literal{}
 1111:     %% records; if sys_core_fold was run it would fix
 1112:     %% that; if sys_core_fold was not run v3_kernel would
 1113:     %% crash.)
 1114:     compile_forms(M, Core, [clint,ssalint,from_core,no_copt,binary]),
 1115: 
 1116:     ok.
 1117: 
 1118: compile_forms(Mod, Forms, Opts) ->
 1119:     case compile:forms(Forms, [report_errors|Opts]) of
 1120: 	{ok,Mod,_} ->  ok;
 1121: 	Other -> throw({error,Other})
 1122:     end.
 1123: 
 1124: %% Pretty-print core and read it back. Should be identical.
 1125: 
 1126: core_roundtrip(Config) ->
 1127:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1128:     Outdir = filename:join(PrivDir, atom_to_list(?FUNCTION_NAME)),
 1129:     ok = file:make_dir(Outdir),
 1130: 
 1131:     TestBeams = get_unique_beam_files(),
 1132: 
 1133:     Test = fun(F) -> do_core_roundtrip(F, Outdir) end,
 1134:     case erlang:system_info(wordsize) of
 1135:         4 ->
 1136:             %% This test case is very memory intensive. Only
 1137:             %% use a single process.
 1138:             test_lib:p_run(Test, TestBeams, 1);
 1139:         8 ->
 1140:             test_lib:p_run(Test, TestBeams)
 1141:     end.
 1142: 
 1143: do_core_roundtrip(Beam, Outdir) ->
 1144:     try
 1145: 	{ok,{Mod,[{abstract_code,{raw_abstract_v1,Abstr}}]}} =
 1146: 	    beam_lib:chunks(Beam, [abstract_code]),
 1147: 	do_core_roundtrip_1(Mod, Abstr, Outdir)
 1148:     catch
 1149: 	throw:{error,Error} ->
 1150: 	    io:format("*** compilation failure '~p' for file ~s\n",
 1151: 		      [Error,Beam]),
 1152: 	    error;
 1153: 	Class:Error:Stk ->
 1154: 	    io:format("~p: ~p ~p\n~p\n", [Beam,Class,Error,Stk]),
 1155: 	    error
 1156:     end.
 1157: 
 1158: do_core_roundtrip_1(Mod, Abstr, Outdir) ->
 1159:     {ok,Mod,Core0} = compile:forms(Abstr, [to_core0]),
 1160:     do_core_roundtrip_2(Mod, Core0, Outdir),
 1161: 
 1162:     %% Primarily, test that annotations are accepted for all
 1163:     %% constructs. Secondarily, smoke test cerl_trees:label/1.
 1164:     {Core1,_} = cerl_trees:label(Core0),
 1165:     do_core_roundtrip_2(Mod, Core1, Outdir),
 1166: 
 1167:     %% Run the inliner to force generation of variables
 1168:     %% with numeric names.
 1169:     {ok,Mod,Core2} = compile:forms(Abstr, [inline,to_core]),
 1170:     do_core_roundtrip_2(Mod, Core2, Outdir).
 1171: 
 1172: do_core_roundtrip_2(M, Core0, Outdir) ->
 1173:     CoreFile = filename:join(Outdir, atom_to_list(M)++".core"),
 1174:     CorePP = core_pp:format_all(Core0),
 1175:     ok = file:write_file(CoreFile, unicode:characters_to_binary(CorePP)),
 1176: 
 1177:     %% Parse the .core file and return the result as Core Erlang Terms.
 1178:     Core2 = case compile:file(CoreFile, [report_errors,from_core,
 1179: 					 no_copt,to_core,binary]) of
 1180: 		{ok,M,Core1} -> Core1;
 1181: 		Other -> throw({error,Other})
 1182: 	    end,
 1183:     Core = undo_var_translation(Core2),
 1184:     ok = file:delete(CoreFile),
 1185: 
 1186:     case cmp_core(Core0, Core, M) of
 1187: 	true -> ok;
 1188: 	false -> error
 1189:     end.
 1190: 
 1191: undo_var_translation(Tree) ->
 1192:     F = fun(Node) ->
 1193: 		case cerl:is_c_var(Node) of
 1194: 		    true ->
 1195: 			Name0 = cerl:var_name(Node),
 1196: 			try atom_to_list(Name0) of
 1197: 			    "_X"++Name ->
 1198: 				cerl:update_c_var(Node, list_to_atom(Name));
 1199: 			    "_"++Name ->
 1200: 				cerl:update_c_var(Node, list_to_atom(Name));
 1201: 			    _ ->
 1202: 				Node
 1203: 			catch
 1204: 			    error:badarg ->
 1205: 				Node
 1206: 
 1207: 			end;
 1208: 		    false ->
 1209: 			Node
 1210: 		end
 1211: 	end,
 1212:     cerl_trees:map(F, Tree).
 1213: 
 1214: cmp_core(E, E, _Mod) ->
 1215:     true;
 1216: cmp_core(M1, M2, Mod) ->
 1217:     cmp_core_fs(cerl:module_defs(M1), cerl:module_defs(M2), Mod).
 1218: 
 1219: cmp_core_fs([F1|T1], [F2|T2], Mod) ->
 1220:     cmp_core_f(F1, F2, Mod) andalso cmp_core_fs(T1, T2, Mod);
 1221: cmp_core_fs([], [], _Mod) ->
 1222:     true;
 1223: cmp_core_fs(_, _, _Mod) ->
 1224:     false.
 1225: 
 1226: cmp_core_f(E, E, _Mod) ->
 1227:     true;
 1228: cmp_core_f({Name,F1}, {Name,F2}, Mod) ->
 1229:     case diff(F1, F2) of
 1230: 	F1 ->
 1231: 	    true;
 1232: 	Diff ->
 1233: 	    io:format("~p ~p:\n~p\n", [Mod,Name,Diff]),
 1234: 	    false
 1235:     end.
 1236: 
 1237: diff(E, E) ->
 1238:     E;
 1239: diff([H1|T1], [H2|T2]) ->
 1240:     [diff(H1, H2)|diff(T1, T2)];
 1241: diff(T1, T2) when tuple_size(T1) =:= tuple_size(T2) ->
 1242:     case cerl:is_c_var(T1) andalso cerl:is_c_var(T2) of
 1243:         true ->
 1244:             diff_var(T1, T2);
 1245:         false ->
 1246:             case cerl:is_c_map(T1) andalso cerl:is_c_map(T2) of
 1247:                 true ->
 1248:                     diff_map(T1, T2);
 1249:                 false ->
 1250:                     diff_tuple(T1, T2)
 1251:             end
 1252:     end;
 1253: diff(E1, E2) ->
 1254:     {'DIFF',E1,E2}.
 1255: 
 1256: diff_var(V1, V2) ->
 1257:     case {cerl:var_name(V1),cerl:var_name(V2)} of
 1258:         {Same,Same} ->
 1259:             V1;
 1260:         {Name1,Name2} ->
 1261:             %% The inliner uses integers as variable names. Such integers
 1262:             %% are read back as atoms.
 1263:             case is_integer(Name1) andalso
 1264:                 list_to_atom(integer_to_list(Name1)) =:= Name2 of
 1265:                 true ->
 1266:                     V1;
 1267:                 _ ->
 1268:                     cerl:update_c_var(V1, {'DIFF',Name1,Name2})
 1269:             end
 1270:     end.
 1271: 
 1272: %% Annotations for maps are not preserved exactly, but that is not
 1273: %% a real problem. Workaround by not comparing all annotations when
 1274: %% comparing maps.
 1275: 
 1276: diff_map(M, M) ->
 1277:     M;
 1278: diff_map(M1, M2) ->
 1279:     case cerl:get_ann(M1) =:= cerl:get_ann(M2) of
 1280:         false ->
 1281:             diff_tuple(M1, M2);
 1282:         true ->
 1283:             case remove_compiler_gen(M1) =:= remove_compiler_gen(M2) of
 1284:                 true ->
 1285:                     M1;
 1286:                 false ->
 1287:                     diff_tuple(M1, M2)
 1288:             end
 1289:     end.
 1290: 
 1291: diff_tuple(T1, T2) ->
 1292:     L = diff(tuple_to_list(T1), tuple_to_list(T2)),
 1293:     list_to_tuple(L).
 1294: 
 1295: remove_compiler_gen(M) ->
 1296:     Arg0 = cerl:map_arg(M),
 1297:     Arg = cerl:set_ann(Arg0, []),
 1298:     Es0 = cerl:map_es(M),
 1299:     Es = [remove_compiler_gen_1(Pair) || Pair <- Es0],
 1300:     cerl:update_c_map(M, Arg, Es).
 1301: 
 1302: remove_compiler_gen_1(Pair) ->
 1303:     Op0 = cerl:map_pair_op(Pair),
 1304:     Op = cerl:set_ann(Op0, []),
 1305:     K = map_var(cerl:map_pair_key(Pair)),
 1306:     V = map_var(cerl:map_pair_val(Pair)),
 1307:     cerl:update_c_map_pair(Pair, Op, K, V).
 1308: 
 1309: map_var(Var) ->
 1310:     case cerl:is_c_var(Var) of
 1311:         true ->
 1312:             case cerl:var_name(Var) of
 1313:                 Name when is_atom(Name) ->
 1314:                     L = atom_to_list(Name),
 1315:                     try list_to_integer(L) of
 1316:                         Int ->
 1317:                             cerl:update_c_var(Var, Int)
 1318:                     catch
 1319:                         error:_ ->
 1320:                             Var
 1321:                     end;
 1322:                 _ ->
 1323:                     Var
 1324:             end;
 1325:         false ->
 1326:             Var
 1327:     end.
 1328: 
 1329: %% Compile to Beam assembly language (.S) and then try to
 1330: %% run .S through the compiler again.
 1331: 
 1332: asm(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1333:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1334:     Outdir = filename:join(PrivDir, "asm"),
 1335:     ok = file:make_dir(Outdir),
 1336: 
 1337:     TestBeams = get_unique_beam_files(),
 1338:     Res = test_lib:p_run(fun(F) -> do_asm(F, Outdir) end, TestBeams),
 1339:     Res.
 1340: 
 1341:     
 1342: do_asm(Beam, Outdir) ->
 1343:     {ok,{M,[{abstract_code,{raw_abstract_v1,A}}]}} =
 1344: 	beam_lib:chunks(Beam, [abstract_code]),
 1345:     try
 1346:         Opts = test_lib:opt_opts(M),
 1347: 	{ok,M,Asm} = compile:forms(A, ['S'|Opts]),
 1348: 	AsmFile = filename:join(Outdir, atom_to_list(M)++".S"),
 1349: 	{ok,Fd} = file:open(AsmFile, [write,{encoding,utf8}]),
 1350: 	beam_listing:module(Fd, Asm),
 1351: 	ok = file:close(Fd),
 1352:         case compile:file(AsmFile, [from_asm,binary,report|Opts]) of
 1353: 	    {ok,M,_} ->
 1354: 		ok = file:delete(AsmFile);
 1355: 	    Other ->
 1356: 		io:format("*** failure '~p' for ~s\n",
 1357: 			  [Other,AsmFile]),
 1358: 		error
 1359: 	end
 1360:     catch Class:Error:Stk ->
 1361: 	    io:format("~p: ~p ~p\n~p\n", [M,Class,Error,Stk]),
 1362: 	    error
 1363:     end.
 1364: 
 1365: %% Compile a crafted file which produces the three call instructions
 1366: %% which should have a comment with the called function in clear
 1367: %% text. We check that the expected functions and comments occur in
 1368: %% the listing.
 1369: 
 1370: asm_labels(Config) ->
 1371:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1372:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1373:     InFile = filename:join(DataDir, "asm_labels.erl"),
 1374:     OutDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "asm_labels"),
 1375:     OutFile = filename:join(OutDir, "asm_labels.S"),
 1376:     ok = file:make_dir(OutDir),
 1377:     {ok,asm_labels} = compile:file(InFile, ['S',{outdir,OutDir}]),
 1378:     {ok,Listing} = file:read_file(OutFile),
 1379:     Os = [global,multiline,{capture,all_but_first,list}],
 1380:     {match,[_]} = re:run(Listing, "({call,.+,{f,.+}}\\. % foo/1)", Os),
 1381:     {match,[_]} = re:run(Listing, "({call_only,.+,{f,.+}}\\. % foo/1)", Os),
 1382:     {match,[_]} = re:run(Listing, "({call_last,.+,{f,.+},.+}\\. % bar/1)", Os),
 1383:     ok = file:del_dir_r(OutDir).
 1384: 
 1385: sys_pre_attributes(Config) ->
 1386:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1387:     File = filename:join(DataDir, "attributes.erl"),
 1388:     Mod = attributes,
 1389:     CommonOpts = [binary,report,verbose,
 1390: 		  {parse_transform,sys_pre_attributes}],
 1391:     PreOpts = [{attribute,delete,deleted}],
 1392:     PostOpts = [{attribute,insert,inserted,"value"}],
 1393:     PrePostOpts = [{attribute,replace,replaced,42},
 1394: 		   {attribute,replace,replace_nonexisting,new}],
 1395:     {ok,Mod,Code} = compile:file(File, PrePostOpts ++ PreOpts ++
 1396: 				     PostOpts ++ CommonOpts),
 1397:     code:load_binary(Mod, File, Code),
 1398:     Attr = Mod:module_info(attributes),
 1399:     io:format("~p", [Attr]),
 1400:     {inserted,"value"} = lists:keyfind(inserted, 1, Attr),
 1401:     {replaced,[42]} = lists:keyfind(replaced, 1, Attr),
 1402:     {replace_nonexisting,[new]} = lists:keyfind(replace_nonexisting, 1, Attr),
 1403:     false = lists:keymember(deleted, 1, Attr),
 1404: 
 1405:     %% Cover more code.
 1406:     {ok,Mod,_} = compile:file(File, PostOpts ++ CommonOpts),
 1407:     {ok,Mod,_} = compile:file(File, CommonOpts -- [verbose]),
 1408:     {ok,Mod,_} = compile:file(File, PreOpts ++ CommonOpts),
 1409:     {ok,Mod,_} = compile:file(File,
 1410: 			      [{attribute,replace,replaced,42}|CommonOpts]),
 1411:     {ok,Mod,_} = compile:file(File, PrePostOpts ++ PreOpts ++
 1412: 				  PostOpts ++ CommonOpts --
 1413: 				  [report,verbose]),
 1414:     ok.
 1415: 
 1416: %% Test the dialyzer option to cover more code.
 1417: dialyzer(Config) ->
 1418:     Priv = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1419:     ok = file:set_cwd(proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config)),
 1420:     Opts = [{outdir,Priv},report_errors],
 1421:     M = dialyzer_test,
 1422:     {ok,M} = c:c(M, [dialyzer|Opts]),
 1423:     [{a,b,c}] = M:M(),
 1424: 
 1425:     %% Cover huge line numbers without the 'dialyzer' option.
 1426:     {ok,M} = c:c(M, Opts),
 1427:     [{a,b,c}] = M:M(),
 1428:     ok.
 1429: 
 1430: 
 1431: %% Test that warnings contain filenames and line numbers.
 1432: warnings(_Config) ->
 1433:     Files = get_unique_files(".erl"),
 1434:     test_lib:p_run(fun do_warnings/1, Files).
 1435: 
 1436: do_warnings(F) ->
 1437:     Options = [{feature,maybe_expr,enable},binary,bin_opt_info,recv_opt_info,return],
 1438:     {ok,_,_,Ws} = compile:file(F, Options),
 1439:     do_warnings_1(Ws, F).
 1440: 
 1441: do_warnings_1([{"no_file",Ws}|_], F) ->
 1442:     io:format("~s:\nMissing file for warnings: ~p\n",
 1443: 	      [F,Ws]),
 1444:     error;
 1445: do_warnings_1([{Name,Ws}|T], F) ->
 1446:     case filename:extension(Name) of
 1447: 	".erl" ->
 1448: 	    do_warnings_2(Ws, T, F);
 1449: 	_ ->
 1450: 	    io:format("~s:\nNo .erl extension\n", [F]),
 1451: 	    error
 1452:     end;
 1453: do_warnings_1([], _) -> ok.
 1454: 
 1455: do_warnings_2([{Pos,_,_}=W|T], Next, F) ->
 1456:     case Pos of
 1457: 	Line when is_integer(Line) ->
 1458: 	    do_warnings_2(T, Next, F);
 1459: 	{Line,Col} when is_integer(Line), is_integer(Col) ->
 1460: 	    do_warnings_2(T, Next, F);
 1461: 	true ->
 1462: 	    io:format("~s:\nMissing line number: ~p\n",
 1463: 		      [F,W]),
 1464: 	    error
 1465:     end;
 1466: do_warnings_2([], Next, F) ->
 1467:     do_warnings_1(Next, F).
 1468: 
 1469: message_printing(Config) ->
 1470:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1471:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1472: 
 1473:     BadEncFile = filename:join(DataDir, "bad_enc.erl"),
 1474:     {error,BadEncErrors, []} = compile:file(BadEncFile, [return]),
 1475: 
 1476:     [":7:15: cannot parse file, giving up\n"
 1477:      "%    7| \t    {ok, \"xyz\n"
 1478:      "%     | \t             ^\n\n"
 1479:     ,
 1480:      ":7:15: cannot translate from UTF-8\n"
 1481:      "%    7| \t    {ok, \"xyz\n"
 1482:      "%     | \t             ^\n\n"
 1483:     ] = messages(BadEncErrors),
 1484: 
 1485:     UTF8File = filename:join(DataDir, "col_utf8.erl"),
 1486:     {ok,_,UTF8Errors} = compile:file(UTF8File, [return]),
 1487:     [":5:23: a term is constructed, but never used\n"
 1488:      "%    5|     B = <<\"xyz\">>,\t<<\"12345\">>,\n"
 1489:      "%     |                      \t^\n\n"
 1490:     ] = messages(UTF8Errors),
 1491: 
 1492:     Latin1File = filename:join(DataDir, "col_lat1.erl"),
 1493:     {ok,_,Latin1Errors} = compile:file(Latin1File, [return]),
 1494:     [":6:23: a term is constructed, but never used\n"
 1495:      "%    6|     B = <<\"xyz\">>,\t<<\"12345\">>,\n"
 1496:      "%     |                      \t^\n\n"
 1497:     ] = messages(Latin1Errors),
 1498: 
 1499:     LongFile = filename:join(PrivDir, "long.erl"),
 1500:     Long = ["-module(long).\n",
 1501:             "-export([foo/0]).\n",
 1502:             "unused() -> ok.\n",
 1503:             lists:duplicate(10000, $\n),
 1504:             "foo() -> bar().\n"],
 1505:     ok = file:write_file(LongFile, Long),
 1506:     {error,LongErrors,LongWarnings} = compile:file(LongFile, [return]),
 1507:     [":10004:10: function bar/0 undefined\n"
 1508:      "% 10004| foo() -> bar().\n"
 1509:      "%      |          ^\n\n"
 1510:     ] = messages(LongErrors),
 1511:     [":3:1: function unused/0 is unused\n"
 1512:      "%    3| unused() -> ok.\n"
 1513:      "%     | ^\n\n"
 1514:     ] = messages(LongWarnings),
 1515:     ok = file:delete(LongFile),
 1516: 
 1517:     {ok,OldCwd} = file:get_cwd(),
 1518:     try
 1519:         ok = file:set_cwd(DataDir),
 1520:         {ok,cover_messages,_} = compile:file(cover_messages, [report, binary])
 1521:     after
 1522:         file:set_cwd(OldCwd)
 1523:     end,
 1524: 
 1525:     ok.
 1526: 
 1527: messages(Errors) ->
 1528:     lists:flatmap(fun ({{File,_L},Descs}) -> format_descs(File, Descs);
 1529:                       ({File,Descs}) -> format_descs(File, Descs)
 1530:                   end,
 1531:                   Errors).
 1532: 
 1533: format_descs(File, Descs) ->
 1534:     [strip_prefix(File, lists:flatten(Text))
 1535:      || {_Where, Text} <- sys_messages:format_messages(File, "", Descs, [])].
 1536: 
 1537: strip_prefix(Prefix, String) ->
 1538:     case string:prefix(String, Prefix) of
 1539:         nomatch -> String;
 1540:         Rest -> Rest
 1541:     end.
 1542: 
 1543: %% Test that the compile:pre_load/0 function (used by 'erlc')
 1544: %% pre-loads the modules that are used by a typical compilation.
 1545: 
 1546: pre_load_check(Config) ->
 1547:     case test_server:is_cover() of
 1548:         true ->
 1549:             {skip,"Cover is running"};
 1550:         false ->
 1551:             try
 1552:                 do_pre_load_check(Config)
 1553:             after
 1554:                 dbg:stop()
 1555:             end
 1556:     end.
 1557: 
 1558: do_pre_load_check(Config) ->
 1559:     DataDir = ?config(data_dir, Config),
 1560:     Simple = filename:join(DataDir, "simple.erl"),
 1561:     Big = filename:join(DataDir, "big.erl"),
 1562:     {ok,_} = dbg:tracer(process, {fun pre_load_trace/2,[]}),
 1563:     dbg:p(self(), call),
 1564:     dbg:p(new, call),
 1565:     {ok,_} = dbg:tpl({?MODULE,get_trace_data,0}, []),
 1566:     {ok,_} = dbg:tp({code,ensure_modules_loaded,1}, []),
 1567: 
 1568:     %% Compile a simple module using the erl_compile interface
 1569:     %% to find out the modules that are pre-loaded by
 1570:     %% compile:pre_load/0.
 1571:     Opts = #options{specific=[binary]},
 1572:     {ok,simple,_} = compile:compile(Simple, "", Opts),
 1573:     [{code,ensure_modules_loaded,[PreLoaded0]}] = get_trace_data(),
 1574:     PreLoaded1 = ordsets:from_list(PreLoaded0),
 1575: 
 1576:     %% Since 'compile' is the function doing the pre-loaded,
 1577:     %% it is useless to include it in the list.
 1578:     case ordsets:is_element(compile, PreLoaded1) of
 1579: 	true ->
 1580: 	    io:put_chars("The 'compile' module should not be included "
 1581: 			 "in the list of modules to be pre-loaded."),
 1582: 	    ct:fail(compile);
 1583: 	false ->
 1584: 	    []
 1585:     end,
 1586:     PreLoaded = ordsets:add_element(compile, PreLoaded1),
 1587: 
 1588:     %% Now unload all pre-loaded modules and all modules in
 1589:     %% compiler application. Then compile a module to find
 1590:     %% which modules that get loaded.
 1591:     CompilerMods = compiler_modules(),
 1592:     Unload = ordsets:union(ordsets:from_list(CompilerMods), PreLoaded),
 1593:     _ = [begin
 1594: 	     code:delete(M),
 1595: 	     code:purge(M)
 1596: 	 end || M <- Unload],
 1597: 
 1598:     {ok,_} = dbg:ctp({code,ensure_modules_loaded,1}),
 1599:     {ok,_} = dbg:tp({code,ensure_loaded,1}, []),
 1600:     {ok,big,_} = compile:file(Big, [binary]),
 1601:     WasLoaded0 = get_trace_data(),
 1602:     WasLoaded1 = [M || {code,ensure_loaded,[M]} <- WasLoaded0],
 1603:     WasLoaded = ordsets:from_list(WasLoaded1),
 1604: 
 1605:     %% Check for modules that should have been pre-loaded.
 1606:     case ordsets:subtract(WasLoaded, PreLoaded) of
 1607: 	[] ->
 1608: 	    ok;
 1609: 	[_|_]=NotPreLoaded ->
 1610: 	    io:format("The following modules were used "
 1611: 		      "but not pre-loaded:\n~p\n",
 1612: 		      [NotPreLoaded]),
 1613: 	    ct:fail({not_preload,NotPreLoaded})
 1614:     end,
 1615: 
 1616:     %% Check for modules that should not be pre-loaded.
 1617:     case ordsets:subtract(PreLoaded, WasLoaded) of
 1618: 	[] ->
 1619: 	    ok;
 1620: 	[_|_]=NotUsed ->
 1621: 	    io:format("The following modules were pre-loaded"
 1622: 		      " but not used:\n~p\n",
 1623: 		      [NotUsed]),
 1624: 	    ct:fail({not_used,NotUsed})
 1625:     end,
 1626: 
 1627:     ok.
 1628: 
 1629: get_trace_data() ->
 1630:     %% Apparantely, doing a receive at the beginning of
 1631:     %% a traced function can cause extra trace messages.
 1632:     %% To avoid that, don't do the receive in this function.
 1633:     do_get_trace_data().
 1634: 
 1635: do_get_trace_data() ->
 1636:     receive
 1637: 	{trace_data,Data} -> Data
 1638:     end.
 1639: 
 1640: pre_load_trace({trace,Pid,call,{?MODULE,get_trace_data,[]}}, Acc) ->
 1641:     Pid ! {trace_data,Acc},
 1642:     [];
 1643: pre_load_trace({trace,_,call,MFA}, Acc) ->
 1644:     [MFA|Acc].
 1645: 
 1646: compiler_modules() ->
 1647:     Wc = filename:join([code:lib_dir(compiler),"ebin","*.beam"]),
 1648:     Ms = filelib:wildcard(Wc),
 1649:     FN = filename,
 1650:     [list_to_atom(FN:rootname(FN:basename(M), ".beam")) || M <- Ms].
 1651: 
 1652: %% Test that ERL_COMPILER_OPTIONS are correctly retrieved
 1653: %% by env_compiler_options/0
 1654: 
 1655: env_compiler_options(_Config) ->
 1656:     Cases = [
 1657:         {"bin_opt_info", [bin_opt_info]},
 1658:         {"recv_opt_info", [recv_opt_info]},
 1659:         {"'S'", ['S']},
 1660:         {"{source, \"test.erl\"}", [{source, "test.erl"}]},
 1661:         {"[{d,macro_one,1},{d,macro_two}]", [{d, macro_one, 1}, {d, macro_two}]},
 1662:         {"[warn_export_all, warn_export_vars]", [warn_export_all, warn_export_vars]}
 1663:     ],
 1664:     F = fun({Env, Expected}) ->
 1665:         true = os:putenv("ERL_COMPILER_OPTIONS", Env),
 1666:         Expected = compile:env_compiler_options()
 1667:     end,
 1668:     lists:foreach(F, Cases).
 1669: 
 1670: %% Test options for compatibility with previous major versions of OTP.
 1671: 
 1672: bc_options(Config) ->
 1673:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1674: 
 1675:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1676: 
 1677:     L = [{171, small_float, [no_line_info,
 1678:                              no_ssa_opt_float,
 1679:                              no_type_opt]},
 1680:          {171, small_float, [no_line_info]},
 1681:          {171, small_float, []},
 1682:          {171, small_float, [r24]},
 1683:          {171, small_float, [r25]},
 1684: 
 1685:          {172, small, [no_ssa_opt_record,
 1686:                        no_ssa_opt_float,
 1687:                        no_line_info,
 1688:                        no_type_opt,
 1689:                        no_bs_match]},
 1690:          {172, small, [r24]},
 1691: 
 1692:          {172, funs, [no_ssa_opt_record,
 1693:                       no_ssa_opt_float,no_line_info,
 1694:                       no_type_opt]},
 1695:          {172, funs, [no_ssa_opt_record,
 1696:                       no_line_info,
 1697:                       no_stack_trimming,
 1698:                       no_type_opt]},
 1699:          {172, funs, [r24]},
 1700: 
 1701:          {172, small_maps, [r24]},
 1702:          {172, small_maps, [no_type_opt]},
 1703: 
 1704:          {172, big, [no_ssa_opt_record,
 1705:                      no_ssa_opt_float,
 1706:                      no_line_info,
 1707:                      no_type_opt]},
 1708:          {172, big, [r24]},
 1709: 
 1710:          {178, small, [r25]},
 1711:          {178, big, [r25]},
 1712:          {178, funs, []},
 1713:          {178, big, []}
 1714:         ],
 1715: 
 1716:     Test = fun({Expected,Mod,Options}) ->
 1717:                    case highest_opcode(DataDir, Mod, Options) of
 1718:                        Expected ->
 1719:                            ok;
 1720:                        Got ->
 1721:                            io:format("*** module ~p, options ~p => got ~p; expected ~p\n",
 1722:                                      [Mod,Options,Got,Expected]),
 1723:                            error
 1724:                    end
 1725:            end,
 1726:     test_lib:p_run(Test, L),
 1727:     ok.
 1728: 
 1729: highest_opcode(DataDir, Mod, Opt) ->
 1730:     Src = filename:join(DataDir, atom_to_list(Mod)++".erl"),
 1731:     {ok,Mod,Beam} = compile:file(Src, [binary,report_errors|Opt]),
 1732:     test_lib:highest_opcode(Beam).
 1733: 
 1734: deterministic_include(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1735:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1736:     Simple = filename:join(DataDir, "simple"),
 1737:  
 1738:     %% Files without +deterministic should differ if their include paths do,
 1739:     %% as their debug info will be different.
 1740:     {ok,_,NonDetA} = compile:file(Simple, [binary, {i,"gurka"}]),
 1741:     {ok,_,NonDetB} = compile:file(Simple, [binary, {i,"gaffel"}]),
 1742:     true = NonDetA =/= NonDetB,
 1743: 
 1744:     %% ... but files with +deterministic shouldn't.
 1745:     {ok,_,DetC} = compile:file(Simple, [binary, deterministic, {i,"gurka"}]),
 1746:     {ok,_,DetD} = compile:file(Simple, [binary, deterministic, {i,"gaffel"}]),
 1747:     true = DetC =:= DetD,
 1748: 
 1749:     ok.
 1750: 
 1751: deterministic_paths(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1752:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1753: 
 1754:     %% Files without +deterministic should differ if they were compiled from a
 1755:     %% different directory.
 1756:     true = deterministic_paths_1(DataDir, "simple", []),
 1757: 
 1758:     %% ... but files with +deterministic shouldn't.
 1759:     false = deterministic_paths_1(DataDir, "simple", [deterministic]),
 1760: 
 1761:     ok.
 1762: 
 1763: deterministic_paths_1(DataDir, Name, Opts) ->
 1764:     Simple = filename:join(DataDir, "simple"),
 1765:     {ok, Cwd} = file:get_cwd(),
 1766:     try
 1767:         {ok,_,A} = compile:file(Simple, [binary | Opts]),
 1768:         ok = file:set_cwd(DataDir),
 1769:         {ok,_,B} = compile:file(Name, [binary | Opts]),
 1770:         A =/= B
 1771:     after
 1772:         file:set_cwd(Cwd)
 1773:     end.
 1774: 
 1775: %% ERL-1058: -compile(debug_info) had no effect
 1776: compile_attribute(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1777:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1778: 
 1779:     %% The test module has a -compile([debug_info]). attribute, which means
 1780:     %% debug information should always be included.
 1781:     debug_info_attribute(DataDir, "debug_info", [debug_info]),
 1782:     debug_info_attribute(DataDir, "debug_info", []),
 1783: 
 1784:     ok.
 1785: 
 1786: debug_info_attribute(DataDir, Name, Opts) ->
 1787:     File = filename:join(DataDir, Name),
 1788:     {ok,_,Bin} = compile:file(File, [binary | Opts]),
 1789:     {ok, {_, Attrs}} = beam_lib:chunks(Bin, [debug_info]),
 1790: 
 1791:     [{debug_info,{debug_info_v1,erl_abstract_code, {Forms, _}}}] = Attrs,
 1792:     [{attribute,{1,1},file,{_,1}},
 1793:      {attribute,{1,2},module,debug_info},
 1794:      {attribute,{2,2},compile,[debug_info]},
 1795:      {eof,_}] = forms_to_terms(Forms),
 1796: 
 1797:     ok.
 1798: 
 1799: forms_to_terms(Forms) ->
 1800:     [erl_parse:anno_to_term(Form) || Form <- Forms].
 1801: 
 1802: %% Test compiler options not tested in other test cases.
 1803: other_options(Config) ->
 1804:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1805: 
 1806:     %% Smoke test of no_spawn_compiler_process, brief, and absolute_source
 1807:     %% options.
 1808:     Big = filename:join(DataDir, "big"),
 1809:     {ok,big,<<_/binary>>} =
 1810:         compile:file(Big, [binary,
 1811:                            no_spawn_compiler_process,
 1812:                            brief,
 1813:                            absolute_source,
 1814:                            report]),
 1815: 
 1816:     %% Test generating a compressed BEAM file. Also cover the redundant
 1817:     %% `beam` option and the `no_inline` option.
 1818:     Small = filename:join(DataDir, "small"),
 1819:     {ok,small} = compile:file(Small, [report, no_inline, compressed, beam]),
 1820: 
 1821:     ok.
 1822: 
 1823: %% Test core transforms and parse transforms.
 1824: transforms(Config) ->
 1825:     {ok, Cwd} = file:get_cwd(),
 1826:     try
 1827:         do_transforms(Config)
 1828:     after
 1829:         file:set_cwd(Cwd)
 1830:     end.
 1831: 
 1832: do_transforms(Config) ->
 1833:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1834:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1835:     TargetDir = filename:join(PrivDir, ?FUNCTION_NAME),
 1836:     ok = file:make_dir(TargetDir),
 1837:     ok = file:set_cwd(TargetDir),
 1838: 
 1839:     %% Compile our parse transforms.
 1840:     LinePt = filename:join(DataDir, "line_pt"),
 1841:     {ok,line_pt} = compile:file(LinePt, [report, {outdir,TargetDir}]),
 1842:     ColumnPt = filename:join(DataDir, "column_pt"),
 1843:     {ok,column_pt} = compile:file(ColumnPt, [report, {outdir,TargetDir}]),
 1844:     GenericPt = filename:join(DataDir, "generic_pt"),
 1845:     {ok,generic_pt} = compile:file(GenericPt, [report, {outdir,TargetDir}]),
 1846: 
 1847:     %% Compile a file using line_pt and verify that column numbers
 1848:     %% have been stripped.
 1849:     Big = filename:join(DataDir, "big"),
 1850:     {[],[_|_]} = compile_partition_warnings(Big, [{parse_transform,line_pt}]),
 1851: 
 1852:     %% Compile a file using column_pt and verify that column numbers
 1853:     %% have NOT been stripped.
 1854:     {[_|_],[]} = compile_partition_warnings(Big, [{parse_transform,column_pt}]),
 1855: 
 1856:     %% Compile a file using column_pt and error_location=line and verify
 1857:     %% that column numbers have been stripped.
 1858:     {[],[_|_]} = compile_partition_warnings(Big, [{error_location,line},
 1859:                                                   {parse_transform,column_pt}]),
 1860: 
 1861:     %% Compile a file using column_pt, line_pt and verify
 1862:     %% that column numbers have been stripped.
 1863:     {[],[_|_]} = compile_partition_warnings(Big, [{parse_transform,column_pt},
 1864:                                                   {parse_transform,line_pt}]),
 1865: 
 1866:     %% Compile a file using column_pt that adds columns and error_location=line and
 1867:     %% verify that column numbers have been stripped.
 1868:     {[],[_|_]} = compile_partition_warnings(Big, [{error_location,line},
 1869:                                                   add_columns,
 1870:                                                   {parse_transform,column_pt}]),
 1871: 
 1872:     %% Compile a file using column_pt that adds columns and error_location=line and
 1873:     %% then call column_pt again to check that columns are stripped in between calls.
 1874:     %% and then verify that column numbers have been stripped from output.
 1875:     {[],[_|_]} = compile_partition_warnings(Big, [{error_location,line},
 1876:                                                   add_columns,
 1877:                                                   {parse_transform,column_pt},
 1878:                                                   {parse_transform,column_pt}]),
 1879: 
 1880:     %% Compile a file using column_pt that adds columns and en error and error_location=line and
 1881:     %% verify that column numbers have been stripped.
 1882:     {error,[{_What,[{Line,_,_}]}],[_|_]} =
 1883:         compile_partition_warnings(Big, [{error_location,line},
 1884:                                          add_columns,
 1885:                                          add_error,
 1886:                                          {parse_transform,column_pt}]),
 1887:     true = is_integer(Line),
 1888: 
 1889:     %% Cover transform code implementing the `time` option.
 1890:     {ok,big,_} = compile:file(Big, [binary, time, report,
 1891:                                     {core_transform,generic_pt},
 1892:                                     {parse_transform,generic_pt}]),
 1893: 
 1894:     %% Test exceptions from a core transform.
 1895:     Simple = filename:join(DataDir, simple),
 1896:     error = compile:file(Simple, [report, {core_transform,generic_pt}, {action, crash}]),
 1897:     {error,_,[]} = compile:file(Simple, [return, {core_transform,generic_pt}, {action, crash}]),
 1898: 
 1899:     error = compile:file(Simple, [report, {core_transform,generic_pt}, {action, throw}]),
 1900:     {error,_,[]} = compile:file(Simple, [return, {core_transform,generic_pt}, {action, throw}]),
 1901: 
 1902:     error = compile:file(Simple, [report, {core_transform,generic_pt}, {action, exit}]),
 1903:     {error,_,[]} = compile:file(Simple, [return, {core_transform,generic_pt}, {action, exit}]),
 1904: 
 1905:     %% Test exceptions from a parse transform.
 1906:     error = compile:file(Simple, [report, {parse_transform,generic_pt}, {action, crash}]),
 1907:     {error,_,[]} = compile:file(Simple, [return, {parse_transform,generic_pt}, {action, crash}]),
 1908: 
 1909:     error = compile:file(Simple, [report, {parse_transform,generic_pt}, {action, throw}]),
 1910:     {error,_,[]} = compile:file(Simple, [return, {parse_transform,generic_pt}, {action, throw}]),
 1911:
