 1912:     error = compile:file(Simple, [report, {parse_transform,generic_pt}, {action, exit}]),
 1913:     {error,_,[]} = compile:file(Simple, [return, {parse_transform,generic_pt}, {action, exit}]),
 1914: 
 1915:     %% Test generating errors and warnings in a parse_transform.
 1916:     {ok,simple} = compile:file(Simple, [report, {parse_transform,generic_pt}, {action, warning}]),
 1917:     {ok,simple,[_|_]} = compile:file(Simple, [return, {parse_transform,generic_pt}, {action, warning}]),
 1918:     error = compile:file(Simple, [report, {parse_transform,generic_pt}, {action, error}]),
 1919:     {error,[_|_],[_|_]} = compile:file(Simple, [return, {parse_transform,generic_pt}, {action, error}]),
 1920:     error = compile:file(Simple, [report, {parse_transform,generic_pt}, {action, undefined_error}]),
 1921:     {error,[_|_],[]} = compile:file(Simple, [return, {parse_transform,generic_pt}, {action, undefined_error}]),
 1922: 
 1923:     ok.
 1924: 
 1925: compile_partition_warnings(Source, Opts) ->
 1926:     case compile:file(Source, [binary, return | Opts]) of
 1927:         {ok,big,<<_/binary>>,Ws0} ->
 1928:             [{_SourcePath,Ws}] = Ws0,
 1929: 
 1930:             %% Return {[ColumnWarning], [LineWarning]}.
 1931:             lists:partition(fun({{L,C},_,_}) when is_integer(L), is_integer(C) -> true;
 1932:                                ({L,_,_}) when is_integer(L) -> false
 1933:                             end, Ws);
 1934:         Error ->
 1935:             Error
 1936:     end.
 1937: 
 1938: %% Cover the erl_compile API used by erlc.
 1939: erl_compile_api(Config) ->
 1940:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1941:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1942:     Simple = filename:join(DataDir, "simple.erl"),
 1943: 
 1944:     Opts = #options{outdir=PrivDir},
 1945:     BinOpts = Opts#options{specific=[binary]},
 1946: 
 1947:     ok = compile:compile(Simple, "ignored", Opts),
 1948:     ok = compile:compile(Simple, "ignored", Opts#options{cwd=PrivDir,includes=[PrivDir]}),
 1949:     {ok,simple,_} = compile:compile(Simple, "ignored", BinOpts),
 1950: 
 1951:     ok = compile:compile(Simple, "ignored", Opts#options{specific=[dabstr]}),
 1952:     ok = compile:compile(Simple, "ignored", Opts#options{specific=[to_core]}),
 1953:     ok = compile:compile(Simple, "ignored", Opts#options{specific=[to_asm]}),
 1954: 
 1955:     SimpleAbstr = filename:join(PrivDir, "simple.abstr"),
 1956:     SimpleCore = filename:join(PrivDir, "simple.core"),
 1957:     SimpleAsm = filename:join(PrivDir, "simple.S"),
 1958: 
 1959:     ok = compile:compile_abstr(SimpleAbstr, "ignored", Opts),
 1960:     ok = compile:compile_core(SimpleCore, "ignored", Opts),
 1961:     ok = compile:compile_asm(SimpleAsm, "ignored", Opts),
 1962: 
 1963:     {ok,simple,<<_/binary>>} = compile:compile_abstr(SimpleAbstr, "ignored", BinOpts),
 1964:     {ok,simple,<<_/binary>>} = compile:compile_core(SimpleCore, "ignored", BinOpts),
 1965:     {ok,simple,<<_/binary>>} = compile:compile_asm(SimpleAsm, "ignored", BinOpts),
 1966: 
 1967:     NeedsDefines = filename:join(DataDir, "needs_defines.erl"),
 1968:     ok = compile:compile(NeedsDefines, "ignored", Opts#options{defines=[compile_this,{'TEST_RESULT',whatever}]}),
 1969: 
 1970:     ok = file:delete(SimpleAbstr),
 1971:     ok = file:delete(SimpleCore),
 1972:     ok = file:delete(SimpleAsm),
 1973:     ok = file:delete(filename:join(PrivDir, "simple.beam")),
 1974:     ok = file:delete(filename:join(PrivDir, "needs_defines.beam")),
 1975: 
 1976:     ok.
 1977: 
 1978: %% Check that an ssa dump contains the pretty printed types we expect.
 1979: %% The module we compile and dump, types_pp, is crafted so it contains
 1980: %% calls to functions which have the result types we want to check the
 1981: %% pretty printer for. We check all types except for bs_context,
 1982: %% bs_matchable and the interval form of float as the first two never
 1983: %% seem to appear in result types and the latter doesn't appear in any
 1984: %% module compiled by diffable.
 1985: types_pp(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1986:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1987:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1988:     TargetDir = filename:join(PrivDir, types_pp),
 1989:     File = filename:join(DataDir, "types_pp.erl"),
 1990:     Listing = filename:join(TargetDir, "types_pp.ssaopt"),
 1991:     ok = file:make_dir(TargetDir),
 1992: 
 1993:     {ok,_} = compile:file(File, [dssaopt, {outdir, TargetDir}]),
 1994:     {ok, Data} = file:read_file(Listing),
 1995:     Lines = string:split(binary_to_list(Data), "\n", all),
 1996:     ResultTypes = get_result_types(Lines),
 1997:     io:format("Calls: ~p~n", [ResultTypes]),
 1998: 
 1999:     TypesToCheck = [{make_atom, "'an_atom'"},
 2000:                     {make_number, "number()"},
 2001:                     {make_float, "3.14"},
 2002:                     {make_integer, "17"},
 2003:                     {make_integer_range, "0..3"},
 2004:                     {make_nil, "nil()"},
 2005:                     {make_list, "list(any())"},
 2006:                     {make_list_of_ints, "list(integer())"},
 2007:                     {make_maybe_improper_list,
 2008:                      "maybe_improper_list(any(), any())"},
 2009:                     {make_nonempty_list, "nonempty_list(any())"},
 2010:                     {make_nonempty_improper_list,
 2011:                      "nonempty_improper_list(any(), ''end'')"},
 2012:                     {make_empty_map, "#{}"},
 2013:                     {make_map, "map()"},
 2014:                     {make_map_known_types, "#{integer()=>float()}"},
 2015:                     {make_fun_unknown_arity_known_type,
 2016:                      "fun((...) -> number())"},
 2017:                     {make_fun_known_arity_known_type,
 2018:                      "fun((_, _) -> number())"},
 2019:                     {make_fun_unknown_arity_unknown_type,
 2020:                      "fun()"},
 2021:                     {make_fun_known_arity_unknown_type,
 2022:                      "fun((_, _))"},
 2023:                     {make_unconstrained_tuple, "{...}"},
 2024:                     {make_known_size_tuple,
 2025:                      "{any(), any(), any(), any(), any()}"},
 2026:                     {make_inexact_tuple, "{any(), any(), any(), ...}"},
 2027:                     {make_union,
 2028:                      "'foo' | nonempty_list(1..3) | number(3, 7) |"
 2029:                      " {'tag0', 1, 2} | {'tag1', 3, 4} | bitstring(8)"},
 2030:                     {make_bitstring, "bitstring(8)"},
 2031:                     {make_none, "none()"}],
 2032:     lists:foreach(fun({FunName, Expected}) ->
 2033:                           Actual = map_get(atom_to_list(FunName), ResultTypes),
 2034:                           case Actual of
 2035:                               Expected ->
 2036:                                   ok;
 2037:                               _ ->
 2038:                                   ct:fail("Expected type of ~p is ~s, found ~s",
 2039:                                           [FunName, Expected, Actual])
 2040:                           end
 2041:                   end, TypesToCheck),
 2042:     ok = file:del_dir_r(TargetDir),
 2043:     ok.
 2044: 
 2045: %% Parsing for result types. Remember the last seen "Result type"
 2046: %% annotation and apply it to calls when we see them to a call when we
 2047: %% see them.
 2048: get_result_types(Lines) ->
 2049:     get_result_types(Lines, none, #{}).
 2050: 
 2051: get_result_types(["  %% Result type:"++_,"  %%    "++TypeLine|Lines], _, Acc) ->
 2052:     get_result_types(Lines, TypeLine, Acc);
 2053: get_result_types([Line|Lines], TypeLine, Acc0) ->
 2054:     Split = string:split(Line, "="),
 2055:     Acc = case Split of
 2056:               [_, " call" ++ Rest] ->
 2057:                   case string:split(Rest, "`", all) of
 2058:                       [_,Callee,_] ->
 2059:                           Acc0#{ Callee => TypeLine };
 2060:                       _ ->
 2061:                           Acc0
 2062:                   end;
 2063:               _ ->
 2064:                   Acc0
 2065:           end,
 2066:     get_result_types(Lines, TypeLine, Acc);
 2067: get_result_types([], _, Acc) ->
 2068:     Acc.
 2069: 
 2070: %% Check that the beam_ssa_type pass knows about bs_init_writable.
 2071: bs_init_writable(Config) ->
 2072:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 2073:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 2074:     InFile = filename:join(DataDir, "bs_init_writable.erl"),
 2075:     OutDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "bs_init_writable"),
 2076:     OutFile = filename:join(OutDir, "bs_init_writable.S"),
 2077:     ok = file:make_dir(OutDir),
 2078:     {ok,bs_init_writable} = compile:file(InFile, ['S',{outdir,OutDir}]),
 2079:     {ok,Listing} = file:read_file(OutFile),
 2080:     Os = [global,multiline,{capture,all_but_first,list}],
 2081:     %% The is_bitstr test should be optimized away.
 2082:     nomatch = re:run(Listing, "({test,is_bitstr,.+})", Os),
 2083:     %% The is_bitstr test should be optimized away.
 2084:     nomatch = re:run(Listing, "({test,is_binary,.+})", Os),
 2085:     ok = file:del_dir_r(OutDir).
 2086: 
 2087: 
 2088: %% Check that an SSA listing contains pretty printed annotations, this
 2089: %% blindly checks that the expected annotation occurs the expected
 2090: %% number of times. Checking that the annotations are correctly placed
 2091: %% and contains the correct information is done in
 2092: %% beam_ssa_check_SUITE.
 2093: annotations_pp(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2094:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 2095:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 2096:     TargetDir = filename:join(PrivDir, types_pp),
 2097:     File = filename:join(DataDir, "annotations_pp.erl"),
 2098:     Listing = filename:join(TargetDir, "annotations_pp.ssaopt"),
 2099:     ok = file:make_dir(TargetDir),
 2100: 
 2101:     {ok,_} = compile:file(File, [dssaopt, {outdir, TargetDir}]),
 2102:     {ok, Data} = file:read_file(Listing),
 2103:     Lines = string:split(binary_to_list(Data), "\n", all),
 2104: 
 2105:     ResultTypes = get_annotations("  %% Result type:", Lines),
 2106:     10 = length(ResultTypes),
 2107: 
 2108:     Uniques = get_annotations("  %% Unique:", Lines),
 2109:     10 = length(Uniques),
 2110: 
 2111:     Aliased = get_annotations("  %% Aliased:", Lines),
 2112:     13 = length(Aliased),
 2113: 
 2114:     ok = file:del_dir_r(TargetDir),
 2115:     ok.
 2116: 
 2117: get_annotations(Key, [Key,"  %%    "++Anno|Lines]) ->
 2118:     [Anno|get_annotations(Key, Lines)];
 2119: get_annotations(Key, [_|Lines]) ->
 2120:     get_annotations(Key, Lines);
 2121: get_annotations(_, []) ->
 2122:     [].
 2123: 
 2124: option_order(Config) ->
 2125:     Ts = [{spec1,
 2126:            ~"""
 2127:             -compile(nowarn_missing_spec).
 2128:             foo() -> ok.
 2129:             """,
 2130:            [],                                  %Environment
 2131:            [warn_missing_spec],
 2132:            []},
 2133:           {spec2,
 2134:            ~"""
 2135:             foo() -> ok.
 2136:             """,
 2137:            [{"ERL_COMPILER_OPTIONS", "warn_missing_spec"}],
 2138:            [nowarn_missing_spec],
 2139:            []},
 2140:           {spec3,
 2141:            ~"""
 2142:             -compile(nowarn_missing_spec).
 2143:             foo() -> ok.
 2144:             """,
 2145:            [{"ERL_COMPILER_OPTIONS", "nowarn_missing_spec"}],
 2146:            [warn_missing_spec],
 2147:            []},
 2148:           {spec4,
 2149:            ~"""
 2150:             -compile(warn_missing_spec).
 2151:             foo() -> ok.
 2152:             """,
 2153:            [{"ERL_COMPILER_OPTIONS", "nowarn_missing_spec"}],
 2154:            [],
 2155:            {warnings,[{{2,1},erl_lint,{missing_spec,{foo,0}}}]}
 2156:           },
 2157:           {spec5,
 2158:            ~"""
 2159:             -compile([warn_missing_spec,nowarn_missing_spec]).
 2160:             foo() -> ok.
 2161:             """,
 2162:            [{"ERL_COMPILER_OPTIONS", "nowarn_missing_spec"}],
 2163:            [warn_missing_spec],
 2164:            []},
 2165:           {records1,
 2166:            ~"""
 2167:             -record(r, {x,y}).
 2168:             rec_test(#r{x=X,y=Y}) -> X + Y.
 2169:             """,
 2170:            [],
 2171:            [strict_record_tests],
 2172:            fun(M) ->
 2173:                    try M:rec_test({r,1,2,3}) of
 2174:                        3 ->
 2175:                            fail()
 2176:                    catch
 2177:                        error:function_clause ->
 2178:                            ok
 2179:                    end
 2180:            end},
 2181:           {records2,
 2182:            ~"""
 2183:             -record(r, {x,y}).
 2184:             rec_test(R) -> R#r.x + R#r.y.
 2185:             """,
 2186:            [],
 2187:            [no_strict_record_tests],
 2188:            fun(M) ->
 2189:                    3 = M:rec_test({r,1,2,3}),
 2190:                    ok
 2191:            end},
 2192:           {records3,
 2193:            ~"""
 2194:             -compile(no_strict_record_tests).
 2195:             -record(r, {x,y}).
 2196:             rec_test(R) -> R#r.x + R#r.y.
 2197:             """,
 2198:            [],
 2199:            [strict_record_tests],
 2200:            fun(M) ->
 2201:                    3 = M:rec_test({r,1,2,3}),
 2202:                    ok
 2203:            end},
 2204:           {records4,
 2205:            ~"""
 2206:             -record(r, {x,y}).
 2207:             rec_test(#r{x=X,y=Y}) -> X + Y.
 2208:             """,
 2209:            [{"ERL_COMPILER_OPTIONS", "strict_record_tests"}],
 2210:            [],
 2211:            fun(M) ->
 2212:                    try M:rec_test({r,1,2,3}) of
 2213:                        3 ->
 2214:                            fail()
 2215:                    catch
 2216:                        error:function_clause ->
 2217:                            ok
 2218:                    end
 2219:            end},
 2220:           {records5,
 2221:            ~"""
 2222:             -record(r, {x,y}).
 2223:             rec_test(R) -> R#r.x + R#r.y.
 2224:             """,
 2225:            [{"ERL_COMPILER_OPTIONS", "strict_record_tests"}],
 2226:            [no_strict_record_tests],
 2227:            fun(M) ->
 2228:                    3 = M:rec_test({r,1,2,3}),
 2229:                    ok
 2230:            end},
 2231:           {records6,
 2232:            ~"""
 2233:             -compile(no_strict_record_tests).
 2234:             -record(r, {x,y}).
 2235:             rec_test(R) -> R#r.x + R#r.y.
 2236:             """,
 2237:            [{"ERL_COMPILER_OPTIONS", "strict_record_tests"}],
 2238:            [],
 2239:            fun(M) ->
 2240:                    3 = M:rec_test({r,1,2,3}),
 2241:                    ok
 2242:            end},
 2243:           {records7,
 2244:            ~"""
 2245:             -record(r, {x,y}).
 2246:             rec_test(R) -> R#r.x + R#r.y.
 2247:             """,
 2248:            [{"ERL_COMPILER_OPTIONS", "no_strict_record_tests"}],
 2249:            [no_strict_record_tests, strict_record_tests],
 2250:            fun(M) ->
 2251:                    try M:rec_test({r,1,2,3}) of
 2252:                        3 ->
 2253:                            fail()
 2254:                    catch
 2255:                        error:{badrecord,{r,1,2,3}} ->
 2256:                            ok
 2257:                    end
 2258:            end}
 2259: 
 2260:          ],
 2261:     run(Config, Ts),
 2262:     ok.
 2263: 
 2264: %%%
 2265: %%% Utilities.
 2266: %%%
 2267: 
 2268: compile_and_verify(Name, Target, Opts) ->
 2269:     Mod = list_to_atom(filename:basename(Name, ".erl")),
 2270:     {ok,Mod} = compile:file(Name, Opts),
 2271:     {ok,{Mod,[{compile_info,CInfo}]}} = 
 2272: 	beam_lib:chunks(Target, [compile_info]),
 2273:     {options,BeamOpts} = lists:keyfind(options, 1, CInfo),
 2274:     Opts = BeamOpts.
 2275: 
 2276: get_unique_beam_files() ->
 2277:     get_unique_files(".beam").
 2278: 
 2279: get_unique_files(Ext) ->
 2280:     Wc = filename:join(filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)), "*"++Ext),
 2281:     [F || F <- filelib:wildcard(Wc),
 2282: 	  not is_cloned(F, Ext), not is_lfe_module(F, Ext)].
 2283: 
 2284: is_cloned(File, Ext) ->
 2285:     Mod = list_to_atom(filename:basename(File, Ext)),
 2286:     test_lib:is_cloned_mod(Mod).
 2287: 
 2288: is_lfe_module(File, Ext) ->
 2289:     case filename:basename(File, Ext) of
 2290: 	"lfe_" ++ _ -> true;
 2291: 	_ -> false
 2292:     end.
 2293: 
 2294: %% Compiles a test module and returns the list of errors and warnings.
 2295: 
 2296: run(Config, Tests) ->
 2297:     F = fun({N,P,Env,Ws,Run}, _BadL) when is_function(Run, 1) ->
 2298:                 case catch run_test(Config, P, Env, Ws, Run) of
 2299:                     ok ->
 2300:                         ok;
 2301:                     Bad ->
 2302:                         io:format("~nTest ~p failed. Expected~n  ~p~n"
 2303:                                   "but got~n  ~p~n", [N, ok, Bad]),
 2304:                         fail()
 2305:                 end;
 2306:            ({N,P,Env,Ws,Expected}, BadL)
 2307:               when is_list(Expected); is_tuple(Expected) ->
 2308:                 io:format("### ~s\n", [N]),
 2309:                 case catch run_test(Config, P, Env, Ws, none) of
 2310:                     Expected ->
 2311:                         BadL;
 2312:                     Bad ->
 2313:                         io:format("~nTest ~p failed. Expected~n  ~p~n"
 2314:                                   "but got~n  ~p~n", [N, Expected, Bad]),
 2315: 			fail()
 2316:                 end
 2317:         end,
 2318:     lists:foldl(F, [], Tests).
 2319: 
 2320: run_test(Conf, Test0, Env, Options, Run) ->
 2321:     run_test_putenv(Env),
 2322:     Module = "warnings" ++ test_lib:uniq(),
 2323:     Filename = Module ++ ".erl",
 2324:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Conf),
 2325:     Test1 = ["-module(", Module, "). -file( \"", Filename, "\", 1). ", Test0],
 2326:     Test = iolist_to_binary(Test1),
 2327:     File = filename:join(DataDir, Filename),
 2328:     Opts = [binary,export_all,return|Options],
 2329:     ok = file:write_file(File, Test),
 2330: 
 2331:     %% Compile once just to print all warnings (and cover more code).
 2332:     _ = compile:file(File, [binary,export_all,report|Options]),
 2333: 
 2334:     %% Test result of compilation.
 2335:     {ok, Mod, Beam, Warnings} = compile:file(File, Opts),
 2336:     _ = file:delete(File),
 2337: 
 2338:     if
 2339:         is_function(Run, 1) ->
 2340:             {module,Mod} = code:load_binary(Mod, "", Beam),
 2341:             ok = Run(Mod),
 2342:             run_test_unsetenv(Env),
 2343:             true = code:delete(Mod),
 2344:             _ = code:purge(Mod),
 2345:             ok;
 2346:         Run =:= none ->
 2347:             run_test_unsetenv(Env),
 2348:             Res = get_warnings(Warnings),
 2349:             case Res of
 2350:                 [] ->
 2351:                     [];
 2352:                 {warnings, Ws} ->
 2353:                     print_warnings(Ws, Test),
 2354:                     Res
 2355:             end
 2356:     end.
 2357: 
 2358: run_test_putenv(Env) ->
 2359:     _ = [_ = os:putenv(Name, Value) || {Name,Value} <- Env],
 2360:     ok.
 2361: 
 2362: run_test_unsetenv(Env) ->
 2363:     _ = [_ = os:unsetenv(Name) || {Name,_Value} <- Env],
 2364:     ok.
 2365: 
 2366: get_warnings([]) ->
 2367:     [];
 2368: get_warnings(WsL) ->
 2369:     case WsL of
 2370:         [{_File,Ws}] -> {warnings, Ws};
 2371:         _ -> {warnings, WsL}
 2372:     end.
 2373: 
 2374: print_warnings(Warnings, Source) ->
 2375:     Lines = binary:split(Source, <<"\n">>, [global]),
 2376:     Cs = [print_warning(W, Lines) || W <- Warnings],
 2377:     io:put_chars(Cs),
 2378:     ok.
 2379: 
 2380: print_warning({{LineNum,Column},Mod,Data}, Lines) ->
 2381:     Line0 = lists:nth(LineNum, Lines),
 2382:     <<Line1:(Column-1)/binary,_/binary>> = Line0,
 2383:     Spaces = re:replace(Line1, <<"[^\t]">>, <<" ">>, [global]),
 2384:     CaretLine = [Spaces,"^"],
 2385:     [io_lib:format("~p:~p: ~ts\n",
 2386:                    [LineNum,Column,Mod:format_error(Data)]),
 2387:      Line0, "\n",
 2388:      CaretLine, "\n\n"];
 2389: print_warning(_, _) ->
 2390:     [].
 2391: 
 2392: fail() ->
 2393:     ct:fail(failed).
